item.title: Tony Way • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #94
item.itunes:title: Tony Way • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #94
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with actor, comedian, writer and all round sincere talent TONY WAY!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with actor, comedian, writer and all round sincere talent TONY WAY!


Pure goodies for you this week as Brett has a good old fashioned longform chat with Tony, and we all get to know each other that little bit more and it’s all lovely and cosy. I think I find it cosy because Brett recorded this with Tony back in them old pre-lockdown days so there’s that sense of TWO PEOPLE IN A ROOM TALKING! Anyway - it’s a really good one in any sense, as they get along great and Tony’s been in some ace stuff, so yo can expect to hear some jewels dropped on that very subject, including his bootcamp experience (I’ll leave that to him), SALACIOUS Tom Cruise stories (beat that, Buxton and Cornish!), the fine line between happy and emotionally repressed, Star Trek annoyances (I mean we all carry some, right?) and sequel controversies. I’m breaking all kinds of walls here by speaking in the first person throughout but may I say that I’m very impressed by his drum & bass knowledge when he talks about tracks that sampled Predator 2. That is WELL in my wheelhouse right there. Anyway - fourth wall all fixed and back to normal - please enjoy the brilliant TONY WAY!


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

TONY on TWITTER!

TONY on IMDB!

item.title: Romesh Ranganathan • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #93
item.itunes:title: Romesh Ranganathan • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #93
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with national treasure comedian, presenter and podcaster ROMESH RANGANATHAN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with national treasure comedian, presenter and podcaster ROMESH RANGANATHAN!


The memories of an actual face to face encounter now seem so old and faded, it’s hard to even consider such an event. Let alone a live show. Can you even imagine? Well, with things as they are still, Brett has brought the podcast vehicle to your door with facemask and gloved hands once again, with guest in tow, the excellent multi-threat comic Romesh over the internet! Proper good times to be had, conversationally roaming freely with reckless abandon that brings to mind those halcyon days of a couple of months ago, including being a national treasure (Romesh won’t have any of it), his Mum being a breakaway star, the thrill of trying to master stuff (especially in lockdown times), working with the family in the picture and what mayhem or paradise that brings, packing for the afterlife, knockoff Care Bears and a HECK ton more. Such a good one, you’ll thoroughly enjoy. Be excellent to each other folks - shouts and love to you all X


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

ROMESH on THE INTERNET!

ROMESH on TWITTER!

item.title: Shappi Khorsandi • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #92
item.itunes:title: Shappi Khorsandi • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #92
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the brilliant novelist and comedian SHAPPI KHORSANDI!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the brilliant novelist and comedian SHAPPI KHORSANDI!


Brett has hit his lockdown swing a good three or four weeks into this whole mindbending situation, and following his past two week triumphs with the whole zoom recording revelation, he’s going in AGAIN with the great Shappi! A lovely and wide ranging, deep conversation which hits on some surprisingly touching and heartfelt moments. Everything from lockdown thoughts and how working from home has offered her some much needed time with the fam, how her being home so much has turned the cat and dog into trained killers and providers but also messed with the rodent ecosystem somewhat, the existential maladies of having children and some truthful moments, being raised atheist, her genius kids who deliver insight beyond their years, her love of the masculine side of cinema (including Scarface and Rambo of course), and her books and plans and all that good stuff! Go and enjoy, it’s fantastic!


• Just a quick note - as Brett mentions in the intro, I had a bit of a rough time getting this one into listenable shape due to some crazy connection and tech issues, but I did what I could! It’s not perfect, but after a few minutes your ears thankfully adjust and you’ll be fine. I’m very mindful of sound quality and want you to have a good experience so I hope this works okay for your listening! THANK YOU!!!


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

SHAPPI on THE INTERNET!

SHAPPI on TWITTER!

NINA IS NOT OKAY!

BRETT GOLDSTEIN on INSTAGRAM!

item.title: Sarah Keyworth • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #91
item.itunes:title: Sarah Keyworth • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #91
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the truly fantastic and funny comedian, writer, podcaster and general multi-threat SARAH KEYWORTH!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the truly fantastic and funny comedian, writer, podcaster and general multi-threat SARAH KEYWORTH!


A follow on from your previous week's guest, dear listener, as Sarah is the partner of Catherine Bohart and together they host the insanely great 'You'll Do Podcast. In fact I barely had to change last week’s intro paragraph above as it is perfectly fitting! It’s a treat to catch Brett and Sarah in conversation, again in isolation as we deal with the current ongoing situation, and there’s some real nice up top chat about coping in the behind closed doors way in which many of us are. She nails it by referring to the mix of Blitz spirit and despair, but things don’t end there by any means - we hear about how okay her partner is (no really, she’s fine!), the fact that standups face a unique situation in not having that audience feedback of a crowd (which leads to a fantastic idea about doing cold-call crowd work), and of course you get the usual unique observations about life, love, death, the afterlife or lack thereof and all of that good good stuff.

A winner, folks. Love it.


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

item.title: Catherine Bohart • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #90
item.itunes:title: Catherine Bohart • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #90
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the truly fantastic and funny comedian, writer, podcaster and general multi-threat CATHERINE BOHART!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the truly fantastic and funny comedian, writer, podcaster and general multi-threat CATHERINE BOHART!


The second in a series which at this point in time, might well be ongoing for the foreseeable - of course we hope for the best and that it is not extended but whatever does go on, you can be sure that it’s a great setup and works like a dream if this and the previous week are anything to go by… This is an awesome episode with the excellent Catherine who brings it in crazy amounts which all adds up to a lively and bubbly one for ya for episode 90! Covering many angles from the early days, to her time spent dealing with OCD and how heavy those days indeed got (but all with a happy conclusion which results in her achieving a kind of mastery over it all with CBT and medication), how she’s handling the current situation out there in the world co-habiting with her partner and all those adjustments those of us in similar situations make to ensure a happy time of it, and all the while giving YOU the beautiful listener a tremendous experience in the company of she and Brett. What more could you want?! WHAT MORE COULD YOU POSSIBLY WANT?! Exactly. Please enjoy, you surely shall!

item.title: Nick Mohammed • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #89
item.itunes:title: Nick Mohammed • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #89
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the multi-disciplined writer and magician NICK MOHAMMED!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the multi-disciplined writer and magician NICK MOHAMMED!


It truly is a difficult time for us all right now, and by ‘us all’ I mean the world as a whole. This doesn’t need to be said I know but it would feel weird to not talk about it at all. Podcasts are in a very interesting situation as a result, where at this point after isolation it almost feels weird that people used to sit and face each other talking. Doesn’t that seem strange? Anyway, this one was recorded before we were all put on lockdown or self isolating, and so it might be a satisfying and distracting vibe for you this week - a very welcome and friendly session with Brett and Nick as they go in on - well, room service for one - but for the most part, ‘Intelligence’ - the new series created by Nick and featuring Ross from Friends! Sorry, David Schwimmer. As well as that, there’s a lot of really fun and interesting chat happening, so please do set some time aside and enjoy yourself. And as always - be excellent to each other okay? Distant or not. Let’s all be excellent. X


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

item.title: Kiri Pritchard-McLean • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #88
item.itunes:title: Kiri Pritchard-McLean • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #88
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the powerful and brilliant comedian KIRI PRITCHARD-McLEAN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the powerful and brilliant comedian KIRI PRITCHARD-McLEAN!


A very timely episode, this one, probably one of the most timely of them all so far, short of doing and entirely live and in real time one… The first Films To Be Buried With to be recorded remotely, Brett is joined online by Kiri to get into this whole ever-fascinating cinema and life thing. And get into they very much do, while certainly not avoiding the subject at hand and the reason for the isolation… Do I need to mention it? I think you understand. It came out lovely though, and it’s a really interesting energy which you’ll certainly enjoy when compared to the regular face to face episodes. It’s really unique. So please do expect to hear about “that thing” (to invoke Lauryn Hill), tour cancellations, social media usage in times of quarantine, the Caroline Aherne bursary, dealing with parents / parental management, techniques for hiding tears, not being good with scary films, the joy of Christmas and why it remains within her, and her folks over in Wales. Oh but come on you KNOW that’s the tip of the iceberg. Whatever your current situation, from all of us here at Films To Be Buried With, we wish you nothing but the best of health and sanity in the current environment. I mean, we do anyway. But especially now. Huge love to all of you X


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

item.title: Sophie Duker • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #87
item.itunes:title: Sophie Duker • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #87
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the very funny writer and comedian and all round bundle of joy SOPHIE DUKER!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the very funny comedian, writer, presenter and all round bundle of joy SOPHIE DUKER!


I know ‘bundle of joy’ makes it sound like Brett is joined by a baby but I just mean that Sophie is a thorough delight from start to end, and if you haven’t had the good fortune of making her acquaintance yet, your chance is now upon you! Kicking things off with some high end fruit talk up top, which massages smoothly into some analogy making, some good Edinburgh Fringe talk (Brett gave her a solid shoutout last year as someone to look out for at the Fringe and beyond), Paris and the occasional madness held within, blurred lines and a NEVER BEFORE MENTIONED FILM! Can you even believe it? Of course you can. I mean it’s all true… So therefore eminently believable. Okay let’s not get caught in the weeds at this point - just listen eh? It’s an absolute slammer!


FILMS TO BE BURIED WITH is LIVE in BIRMINGHAM on SUNDAY 29th MARCH!


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

SOPHIE on TWITTER!

SOPHIE LIVE SHOWS!

SOPHIE in THE GUARDIAN!

item.title: Films Of 2019 & The Decade w/ Nish Kumar (pt. 2) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein
item.itunes:title: Films Of 2019 & The Decade w/ Nish Kumar (pt. 2) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with 3rd time guest and therefore 3rd time dead NISH KUMAR!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with 3rd time guest and therefore 3rd time dead NISH KUMAR!


THIS IS PART 2 OF A 2 PART SET!!!

Did you catch part 1? Wait, is that a yes or a no? I can’t tell. It’s like your thumb is kind of wavering around the middle like a ‘maybe’. Mmmmm alright I’ll just go with yes then - and in that case, with the answer to the question “Did you catch part 1?” being “YES!”, we can skip over the fancy explanations and descriptions as to what this is and get you straight onto why you came here in the first place. Ladies and gentlemen, please be outrageous and sort of weirdly loud in your welcoming to the guest microphone Mister NISH KUMAR! His now FOURTH welcome! Lucky boy. Still counts as a third appearance though. Let’s not get crazy. Get yourself involved with all the loose ends left from last episode, as Brett and Nish finish what they started and give you, the listening public, their final picks of the year and decade. ENJOY!!!

item.title: Films Of 2019 & The Decade w/ Nish Kumar • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein
item.itunes:title: Films Of 2019 & The Decade w/ Nish Kumar • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with 3rd time guest and therefore 3rd time dead NISH KUMAR!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with 3rd time guest and therefore 3rd time dead NISH KUMAR!


THIS IS PART 1 OF A 2 PART SET so be sure to collect em both, lest you miss out on some ULTRA HEAVY POWERFUL END OF DECADE FILM BANTER! Upper case use for emphasis. You understand. This is a belated selection but entirely welcome, as Brett and Nish go so deep into the whole thing that they require a double episode… Well, as numerical order dictates, this is the first to come, featuring a whole bunch of greatness that shan’t be spoiled here - ohh no, you’ll have to go in yourself and do your own digging there my friend. I can tell you there is a touch of the scatalogical up top, let’s say til about about 15 minutes into the chat, so if you’re not into such behaviour, by all means skip on down that road while blocking your ears. They’ll understand. But otherwise, expect some deep film talk and very interesting takes on films from the previous year and years gone by, in the Extra Massive Super Deluxe Belated Films Of 2019 And The Decade Special Part One with Nish Kumar!


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

item.title: Maisie Adam • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #84
item.itunes:title: Maisie Adam • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #84
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the wise and hilarious comic MAISIE ADAM!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the wise and hilarious comic MAISIE ADAM!


Such a treat this week for ya dear listener, as Brett gets some prime stop and chat time with Maisie, a comic with more wit and wisdom than some in the game for ten times longer… A fascinating and addictive one, as we get to share in so many of her stories and background tales that we all surely become fast friends. From not knowing those unwritten and unspoken ‘rules’ of comedy and how that sped up her progress, to the process of letting past shows fade into the ether, to the “get a grip” mantra of her mum, the battle as old as time of salt vs sweet popcorn (time to pick a side, people), atheism and non-atheism, single life and boyfriend life, virginity stories and ever so much more, as if that wasn’t enough. Powerful stuff, folks! A great one - have fun with Brett and Maisie!


FILMS TO BE BURIED WITH is LIVE in ISLINGTON on the 26th FEB!

item.title: Adam Hess • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #83
item.itunes:title: Adam Hess • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #83
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the awesome and very funny comedian ADAM HESS!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the awesome and very funny comedian ADAM HESS!


Excellent stuff for you this week dear listener, as Brett has a good old get down with Adam and gets DEEP into this whole existential film science from start to end… Going from breaking down comedy bits to their mere particles to examine what makes them funny, to audiences and the relationships made with them, the need for truth or absence of, misunderstanding films, how he used to select films as a kid, simulation theory, religious upbringing and stock phrases in relationships. Oh but SO much more - this is the tip of the iceberg. Or the Hessberg. Whatever you like. PLEASE ENJOY!


FILMS TO BE BURIED WITH is LIVE in ISLINGTON on the 26th FEB!

item.title: Phoebe Walsh • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #82
item.itunes:title: Phoebe Walsh • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #82
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the fantastically funny and awesome writer, comic and showrunner PHEOBE WALSH!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the fantastically funny and awesome writer, comic and showrunner PHEOBE WALSH!


Ohhh this one’s a proper goody this week, ladies and gentlemen. Enjoy the mystic brew of Brett and Phoebe as they get down to the real business of - obviously - film and all things cinematic, but also the greater business of life and matters of the existential. So be prepared for some very real moments involving family members with and not with us (all handled immaculately and hilariously as I’m sure you would expect), as well as writers room traditions and snack selections (and the differences between the USA situation and the UK situation of said rooms), being surrounded by funeralists, the lack of mainstream weepies and the very much not-okay-ness of Carry On films. IT WAS A DIFFERENT TIME. Nevertheless… Anyway - have fun with Phoebe, it’s a lovely episode folks!


FILMS TO BE BURIED WITH is LIVE in ISLINGTON on the 26th FEB!

item.title: Dan Clark • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #81
item.itunes:title: Dan Clark • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #81
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the extremely funny and extremely real DAN CLARK!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the extremely funny and extremely real DAN CLARK!


I almost typed Dan Clark of The Dan Clark Five there. Has a jazz collective feel, no? ANYWAY - all besides the point - Brett is joined by good friend and very funny human Dan Clark to engage in all things life and film, including some heavy afterlife thoughts (I mean, as per usual, but good in depth action this one), being a sucker for rousing music and someone standing up, his dislike of being out of control and all things brain hallucination, his younger days and all of that good stuff… But - as Brett points out up top - be prepared for some health issue talk in the first 10 minutes - I won’t spell it out but it rhymes with “holonic birrigation”, let’s say. So yeah, nothing too outrageous but it’s probably not something to kick off the day with at the breakfast table, know what I’m saying? So, dear listener, with you appropriately cautioned, please enjoy episode 81 of Films To Be Buried With!


FILMS TO BE BURIED WITH is LIVE in ISLINGTON on the 26th FEB!

item.title: Tom Neenan • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #80
item.itunes:title: Tom Neenan • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #80
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the excellent comicsmith and podcaster TOM NEENAN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the excellent comicsmith and podcaster TOM NEENAN!


Top class cinematic goodness this week with Brett and Tom, who get into some full on life stuff and that entails via the infinitely rewarding medium of film. You may know Tom from his stellar work with frequent and welcome show guest Nish Kumar, or maybe Tom’s own podcast ‘Not All Men’ (I remember hearing the first murmurings of it on the Kermode and Mayo podcast), but at any rate this is a perfect opportunity to get to know him all the way better! From his works with Nish and The Mash Report / Mock The Week and so on, to being the first gift giver on the podcast (you’ll have to listen to discover that particular 3 star nugget!), to his own podcast making, crying and how people withholding a cry on film delivers greater impact, chasing the Jurassic Park dragon (or pterodactyl, whatever works) and some amazing proposal plans - it’s all in here and basically a delightful episode! Please enjoy.


FILMS TO BE BURIED WITH is LIVE in ISLINGTON on the 26th FEB!

item.itunes:summary:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the excellent comicsmith and podcaster TOM NEENAN!


Top class cinematic goodness this week with Brett and Tom, who get into some full on life stuff and that entails via the infinitely rewarding medium of film. You may know Tom from his stellar work with frequent and welcome show guest Nish Kumar, or maybe Tom’s own podcast ‘Not All Men’ (I remember hearing the first murmurings of it on the Kermode and Mayo podcast), but at any rate this is a perfect opportunity to get to know him all the way better! From his works with Nish and The Mash Report / Mock The Week and so on, to being the first gift giver on the podcast (you’ll have to listen to discover that particular 3 star nugget!), to his own podcast making, crying and how people withholding a cry on film delivers greater impact, chasing the Jurassic Park dragon (or pterodactyl, whatever works) and some amazing proposal plans - it’s all in here and basically a delightful episode! Please enjoy.


FILMS TO BE BURIED WITH is LIVE in ISLINGTON on the 26th FEB!

item.title: Sarah Snook • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #79
item.itunes:title: Sarah Snook • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #79
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the brilliant actor and all round awesome SARAH SNOOK!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the brilliant actor and all round awesome SARAH SNOOK!


Surely you must know Sarah as ‘Shiv’ from the quite wonderful series ‘Succession’, which is almost too good to even begin getting into here - i would venture to say that you should track it down and prepare for a weekend indoors while you race to get it all finished... If not, keep it in mind for the future okay? Anyway - you will hugely enjoy this one, as Sarah is a delight and does not feature on a to of podcasts either, so it’s a rare treat indeed! They get into many objects of chat including some choice afterlife nuggets involving bread (gold lies within that one), fancy cinemas, days of childhood, that old chestnut and everyone’s friend AALS (aka Altitude Adjusted Lachrymosity Syndrome or crying on planes), how to cry on film and forgetting the film Titanic. Glorious! You’ll love it! You’ll love Sarah!

item.title: Emerald Fennell • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #78
item.itunes:title: Emerald Fennell • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #78
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the amazing actor, showrunner and downright treasure EMERALD FENNELL!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the amazing actor, showrunner and downright treasure EMERALD FENNELL!


A glorious episode with Brett and Fennell, as they get to all the goodies you should expect by now including a little glimpse behind the scenes into Brett’s homestead, Emerald’s superb work showrunning Killing Eve (season 2) and starring in The Crown, her novelist work, fear of death, ‘snack and a video’, imaginary friends, puppet anxiety, Steve Buscemi, forgotten inappropriateness and dread. Oh and TONS more besides… This is a grand one right here folks - trust me, enjoyment is assured!

item.title: Rose Matafeo • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #77
item.itunes:title: Rose Matafeo • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #77
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only 2020! It’s ALSO only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the wonderful funny director comedian presenter ROSE MATAFEO!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only 2020! It is also, of course, only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the gloriously funny New Zealand-based director, comedian and presenter ROSE MATAFEO!


The time will simply breeze by as Brett and Rose get along famously from beginning to end. A proper bubbly way to ring in the new year as they cover it all, from her winning of the Edinburgh Comedy Award (and the experience of that which was naturally weird and surreal but awesome), writing for HBO, Ben Affleck directing himself looking all buff like, the horror of seeing yourself on camera, her film ‘Baby, Done’, her love of all things behind the camera, death anxiety, “death is unacceptable”, and her good crying. And a hell of a lot more. IT’S 2020! We made it! Now enjoy!

item.title: Nish Kumar (live @ BFI) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #76
item.itunes:title: Nish Kumar (live @ BFI) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #76
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the already twice dead on the podcast comedian and writer and presenter NISH KUMAR live at the BFI!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the hilarious writer, comedian and presenter and TWICE DEAD guest on Films To Be Buried With, it’s Nish Kumar AND it’s recorded live at the BFI!


Yes you read correct. This is Nish’s third time dying on the podcast, and so this is truly a man with nothing to lose. A man on the edge. In a world (etc etc etc) - so expect some good time Xmas shenanigans to follow as he Brett dig into the good stuff and come up with some hits of the decade, including misses too! You’ll have a wonderful time, almost as wonderful as if you made it to the BFI and attended in person! WE HOPE YOU ALL HAD WONDERFUL CHRISTMASES EVERYONE - huge love and thanks for a grand old year and please, enjoy this gift from us all here at Films To Be Buried With!

item.title: Dan Swimer • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #75
item.itunes:title: Dan Swimer • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #75
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the writer and behind the scenes developer - it’s DAVID SWIMER!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with behind the scenes comedy writer, heavy hitter and multiple hat wearer DAN SWIMER!


A super damn fine one this week folks, as Brett sits down with Dan to get down deep into the heart of this whole comedy and cinema malarkey. Between them, they cover a good amount of ground and it’s a lovely one to get to know Dan and his many ins and outs. From his co-writing with Simon Amstell in various form, to working with Brett a while back there, to being the ‘JD Sallinger of comedy”, the madness of standup comedy and processes therein, living in LA, Sacha Baron Cohen, being a bad car driver, field cults, the collateral damage of the ‘disturbing kid film’ genre, witches, Stallone, being a sensitive dad, the two ingredients to ensure tears, a round of applause for Emma Thompson, flight rules, his wife and a certain earlier film role, Uncle Joe’s big box o’ VHS tapes, and all manner of other greatness. ENJOY BRETT AND DAN!


UPCOMING SHOW @ THE BFI • DECEMBER 19th!

item.title: Fergus Craig • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #74
item.itunes:title: Fergus Craig • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #74
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the comic actor FERGUS CRAIG!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the hilarious comic actor FERGUS CRAIG!


Pure good times to be had this week, as Brett is joined by the man you will surely recognise from having glasses and a moustache drawn on his face with a sharpie… Coming back to you? Well prepare to get the full inside scoop on that little escapade! On top of that, expect some prime death chat which is that wonderful blend of fun and heavy, along with some class banter about Talking Heads, the under-use of Joan Cusack, not being scared, how ‘cool’ films date terribly, 'Hoff The Record', how films should have a length quota and how 80’s films usually included two definite ingredients (oh and a third to be revealed later on) - action packed excellence, you shall ENJOY!


UPCOMING SHOW @ THE BFI • DECEMBER 19th!

item.title: Kevin Smith • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #73
item.itunes:title: Kevin Smith • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #73
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the podcasting film-writing icon KEVIN SMITH!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the podcast making film writing superhero KEVIN SMITH!


SNOOGINS! Yes indeed folks, genuine goodness right here this week as Brett is joined by the master! As you will have absolutely seen, Kevin is out on promo duty for his new film ‘Jay & Silent Bob Reboot’, which is killing it with audiences who joined the Smith crew on the ground floor or a little further down the road. Brett had a chance to kick it with the man and of course he took that chance and now we can enjoy the results in full! And a full slightly shorter one it is too - you know Kevin can talk and while you get the full benefit of that, you also get to hear his personal movie choices too which is a rare treat! But on top of that, hear everything else including his notice of the UK’s hunger for podcasts, his recent brush with death and how his outlook on life has changed entirely - not to mention the cinematic choices he’s made since, serenity in the hospital, his ‘cinematic gravestone’, how his films are passed down the generations, the impracticality of a drive-in movie, being a good cryer, the three act pornography structure, working with his wife and walking out of films. And SO so much more. A treat. Please enjoy!


UPCOMING SHOW @ THE BFI • DECEMBER 19th!

item.title: Jena Friedman • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #72
item.itunes:title: Jena Friedman • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #72
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the multi-faceted diamond writer, presenter and comedian JENA FRIEDMAN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the multi-faceted diamond writer, presenter and comedian JENA FRIEDMAN!


A superb one here for you, folks - Brett sits down for a nice little chunk of time with Jena, who apparently can do just about everything! Hear all about the whole bit, from her own show on Adult Swim ’Soft Focus’ to writing on The Daily Show and all the other various awesome goodies that enter her path, to she and Brett going back a fair bit, getting into horror movies by accident (it could have happened to anyone), terrible date movie choices (always a nice piece of business), the emotional terrorism of Pixar, love of teen films and a WHOLE GANG MORE! You’ll love it. Get yerself good and involved and enjoy!


UPCOMING SHOW @ THE BFI • DECEMBER 19th!


EPISODE LINKS:

• JENA on TWITTER!

• JENA on THE INTERNET!

• SOFT FOCUS!

• AMERICAN C*NT!

item.itunes:summary:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the multi-faceted diamond writer, presenter and comedian JENA FRIEDMAN!


A superb one here for you, folks - Brett sits down for a nice little chunk of time with Jena, who apparently can do just about everything! Hear all about the whole bit, from her own show on Adult Swim ’Soft Focus’ to writing on The Daily Show and all the other various awesome goodies that enter her path, to she and Brett going back a fair bit, getting into horror movies by accident (it could have happened to anyone), terrible date movie choices (always a nice piece of business), the emotional terrorism of Pixar, love of teen films and a WHOLE GANG MORE! You’ll love it. Get yerself good and involved and enjoy!


UPCOMING SHOW @ THE BFI • DECEMBER 19th!

item.title: Joe Cornish • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #71
item.itunes:title: Joe Cornish • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #71
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the always excellent writer and director JOE CORNISH!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the always excellent writer and director JOE CORNISH!


Conducted in the basement viewing room of the Cornish headquarters, this is an ace chat with Brett and Joe, who go in on all things acting, directing and comedy. It kicks off with some deep thoughts regarding the categorising and filing of DVDs (and cleaning out of), but rapidly fires up as we get treated to all manner of nuggets regarding Joe’s previous works (The Kid Who Would Be King, Hot Fuzz, Attack The Block and MORE!), the positivity of his films as a backlash against miserablist cinema, his love of film closure, the golden age of the Adam & Joe Show, fatherhood, the full background story on what happened with Antman, old cinemas and the ratings of films, being a clothing alteration experimenter as a kid (re: Top Gun - what a treat he created), classic cinema and some naught sexy bits in there too just to pepper the stew a lil’. You will absolutely love this one. ENJOY!


UPCOMING SHOW @ THE BFI • DECEMBER 19th!

item.title: Kate Berlant • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #70
item.itunes:title: Kate Berlant • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #70
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the truly great comedian and actor KATE BERLANT!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the truly awesome comedian, improv and otherwise, and actor KATE BERLANT!


A lovely conversation with Brett and Kate, in a relatively dingey backstage area somewhere in deepest London with several background noise challenges that should hopefully dissolve from your mind pretty swiftly! Kicking things off with some proper comedy chat and gossip about Kate’s background and new show at the Soho Theatre, they get down to the actual business of death and cinema which is what we’ve all been waiting for! A deep one, and a very funny one, with all angles covered including acting and improvisation worlds, evolving improv bits into stage bits, some ace parent talk involving her performance artist mum, dislike of animation and like of real life, and a first where Kate actually adds a new question to the proceedings! How about that. Ladies and gentlemen, Kate Berlant!


EPISODE LINKS:

• KATE on TWITTER!

item.title: Jordan Brookes • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #69
item.itunes:title: Jordan Brookes • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #69
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the excellent and AWARD WINNING comic JORDAN BROOKS!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the wonderful and very award winning comedian JORDAN BROOKS!


Ladies and gentlemen, this week’s episode is definitely extremely funny and very much full of the good stuff, but it’s important to also point out that rather soon in things do get a touch more serious. It’s all been checked and verified that all the content is good to go, but just as a form of trigger warning the topic of suicide does come up. So if that’s a tough one to hear, at least you have that info before going in… It’s a tough one to deal with though, being that Jordan recently won a prestigious comedy award in Edinburgh, and with big awards comes a shift in audiences but all of this gets tackled right here, along with a huge amount of other goodness including life, death, fear of increased attention, being present with the audience, thoughts on ‘cancel culture’, therapy tips and the gratitude diary, how we are all avatars, family dynamics and childhood, adolescence, tricky comedy and the Synecdoche New York State Of Mind. Ooh it’s a hefty one this week, folks. Balanced in all senses. Please enjoy.


Also - please, with all this in mind, let's try and keep communicating with each other... It can be tough sometimes. But never forget that help is out there and storms come and they pass. Give Samaritans a call if you’re not feeling on top of things.


EPISODE LINKS:

• JORDAN on TWITTER!

• JORDAN on THE INTERNET!

• JORDAN in THE GUARDIAN!

• ANOTHER JORDAN PAGE!

item.title: Matthew Shively • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #68
item.itunes:title: Matthew Shively • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #68
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with acting treasure, Nickelodeon and otherwise, MATTHEW SHIVELY!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with acting treasure, Nickelodeon and otherwise, MATTHEW SHIVELY!


To call Matt a child star may risk belittling his achievements, as he has done a huge amount since his early days as Ryan Laserbeam on Nickelodeon’s ‘True Jackson VP’, and you will hear about that very role and all said post-Nick goodness in this thoroughly enjoyable chat with he and Brett! As always, we get deep into our guest’s soul right here, with all manner of life nuggets and wisdom gems being learned and distributed, from those early days acting, being king of the pratfall, his current housing situation and how he arrived there, what he learned from the show, a good Bad Boys chunk which leads to an interesting real life entanglement, whether the enjoyment of film is altered after being so exposed to the inner workings of the machine, the echoes in every day life of a horror film, VERY controversial thoughts on horror films in general, acting coaches and auditions, Shia Labeouf, the beauty of a one-shot and what’s coming soon in his own career. Action packed! Get you some!


EPISODE LINKS:

item.title: Susannah Fielding • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #67
item.itunes:title: Susannah Fielding • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #67
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the glorious actor and all round treasure SUSANNAH FIELDING!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the glorious actor and all round treasure SUSANNAH FIELDING!


…or if you’d rather, Susannah “Boss” Fielding (the origins of which we never really get to!) - she and Brett go back a ways, so it’s really nice to hear them together in the same place getting to the bottom of this whole life and film thing… So prepare to be taken on a really fun journey incorporating everything Susannah, from her early acting career, to her stint in LA being on ‘The Great Outdoors’, to living in panic, to her recent position as Alan Partridge’s co-host on ‘This Time With Alan Partridge’ - and all that entailed from audition onwards, how she is not a fan of quests or sci-fi, being afraid of loneliness and the phantom sibling position, defeating darkness, not being good with horror or for that matter, swimming, and a nice phone interlude which you’ll surely enjoy. Loads going on, a giddy fun one so dig it!

item.title: Jon DeWalt • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #66
item.itunes:title: Jon DeWalt • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #66
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the renowned writer and producer JON DEWALT!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the renowned writer and producer JON DEWALT!


A lovely and giddy episode with a properly infectious energy, as Brett hangs with Jon out in LA and gets down to the good stuff from up top to the very end. Maybe along the way you’ll even pick up some new skool slang too - by that, I mean you’ll be able to throw around words like ‘zaddy’ at will. That’s yours to uncover and enjoy. So please enjoy Brett and zaddy Jon as they get into the whole deal, from being an ‘Instagram baller’, to his working relationship with his wife, his multicam version of himself at work and single cam version at home, how accomplishment are often credited to god, the practice (or profession) of selling films but then them never coming out (it’s a thing apparently), being a skilled cryer, the Larry David / Curb-esque childbirth situation of he and his wife, bromance and many anecdotes to keep you hooked. Great stuff!


EPISODE LINKS:

item.title: Rick Edwards • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #65
item.itunes:title: Rick Edwards • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #65
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the brilliant writer, presenter and podcaster RICK EDWARDS!A splendid slice of film action this week with Brett and Rick,...
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the brilliant writer, presenter and podcaster RICK EDWARDS!


A splendid slice of film action this week with Brett and Rick, as the two go at it in grand style covering so much ground - from Rick’s show ‘!mpossible’, to just having finished a new screenplay, not working with a faceless mob of nobodies (working with a faceful mob of somebodies then…?), always being an attention seeker which led nicely into his current line of work, being heavily into maths and science as you can imagine but then moving into tutoring after uni, which led onto him tutoring Ruby Wax’s kid, which led onto other things, not having a plan, partaking in a graduate scheme for TV and the slow shift into the medium, some great death talk and death as motivation, therapist Brett making all manner of Freudian connections, doing full 360s on films, and the Stathe. YES! Enjoy!


EPISODE LINKS:

• RICK on TWITTER!

• RICK talking about !MPOSSIBLE!

• SCIENCE-ISH PODCAST!

item.itunes:summary:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the brilliant writer, presenter and podcaster RICK EDWARDS!


A splendid slice of film action this week with Brett and Rick, as the two go at it in grand style covering so much ground - from Rick’s show ‘!mpossible’, to just having finished a new screenplay, not working with a faceless mob of nobodies (working with a faceful mob of somebodies then…?), always being an attention seeker which led nicely into his current line of work, being heavily into maths and science as you can imagine but then moving into tutoring after uni, which led onto him tutoring Ruby Wax’s kid, which led onto other things, not having a plan, partaking in a graduate scheme for TV and the slow shift into the medium, some great death talk and death as motivation, therapist Brett making all manner of Freudian connections, doing full 360s on films, and the Stathe. YES! Enjoy!


EPISODE LINKS:

• RICK on TWITTER!

• RICK talking about !MPOSSIBLE!

item.title: Melissa Stephens • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #64
item.itunes:title: Melissa Stephens • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #64
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the truly great comedian and writer MELISSA STEPHENS!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the truly great comedian and writer MELISSA STEPHENS!


From their meeting via a mutual friend, to she and Brett getting acquainted at a comedy show, Melissa and Brett have become fast friends over the past years, and it’s a delight to hear them catch up through the medium of the podcast! Although this is far from just sitting in on two pals catching up with each other - oh no - they ensure the funny is brought, and this is a proper giggler this episode. From her email etiquette, to a friendly clash with Brett on cinema watching styles (we all know by now that Brett is VERY PARTICULAR), to her hilarious and very mad series ‘Finding The Asshole’, to true crime, to sexy cartoons and a sizeable chunk on awakenings and ‘enjoying one’s own company’ later in life. If you get what I’m saying. You do? Marvellous. ENJOY!


EPISODE LINKS:

item.title: Sam Bain • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #63
item.itunes:title: Sam Bain • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #63
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the very highly acclaimed writer SAM BAIN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the very highly acclaimed writer SAM BAIN!


You will absolutely know Sam Bain from his incredible past work as writer on Peep Show (alongside writing partner Jesse Armstrong - a relationship which shall be delved and investigated deeper into), the glorious Four Lions (a past pick on many a Films To Be Buried With), or even the upcoming Corporate Animals (alongside past guest Patrick Brice) - well, now is your chance to know Sam as awesome podcast guest in his own right, as he and Brett sit down and get into it on many angles, including differences between sitcom and film, how he’s more into the film game these days, said relationship with Jesse Armstrong, meditation and silent retreats (and how the latter may have informed the internal monologue of Peep Show), being religious by mistake, crying in private, how the end of Peep Show played out, creating empathy in films, Four Lions and the makings of, and physical comedy - but oh lord SO much more. You will enjoy!


EPISODE LINKS:

item.title: Anne Edmonds • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #62
item.itunes:title: Anne Edmonds • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #62
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the delightful and incredibly funny comedian, actor and podcaster ANNE EDMONDS!You may know her from her sterling podcast...
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the delightful and incredibly funny comedian, actor and podcaster ANNE EDMONDS!


You may know her from her sterling podcasting work over on The Grub (a true madhouse of crazytimes), or maybe from her powerful turn in The Real Dirty Dancing, but surely you know her from being awesomely funny which will be further confirmed in this very podcast! She and Brett go full cinema nerd right here as they cover it all, from said Grub podcast, to the spirit of the podcast medium itself, to her ‘What’s Wrong With You?’ show, her growing up in the same town as Dame Edna Everage, crying on planes and the effect of flying on ones emotions, her earlier years working in mental health and the transition to comedy down the line, well known Australian movies and the stereotypes therein, and a whole heap more besides, including that Real Dirty Dancing appearance... Such a good one here - you shall truly enjoy. Dare I say, you’ll have the time of your liv(*LOUD BANG *silence *TV interference •citywide blackout)…


EPISODE LINKS:

• ANNE on TWITTER!

item.title: Patrick Brice • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #61
item.itunes:title: Patrick Brice • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #61
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the ever so great actor and director PATRICK BRICE!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the ever so great actor and director PATRICK BRICE!


A lovely and lively episode recorded in a secret location in Los Angeles (I mean obviously Brett and Patrick knew where it was) when Brett was over there earlier in the year, which goes all the way into the life, times and psyche of Patrick, all the while showcasing one of the greatest laughs in the business. He’s been working on a ton of stuff over the last decade, including Creep, Creep 2, The Overnight and Corporate Animals to name a mere handful of productions, with a good batch in the cannon too. Here you can expect to be led through a nice chunk of his life via movies as he and Brett get down to it all, including his work on all his films from lo-fi to larger crew productions, the in between takes phone usage of said crews, dealing with problems on set, learning about one’s self, how men deal with being wrong, growing up in the woods, having interesting parents and an equally interesting environment in which to grow up, emotional film interests as a young’un, deep revelations about his own upbringing later in life and a near-Alanis Morissette moment in a cinema. All will make sense (hopefully - especially that last reference…). Enjoy!


EPISODE LINKS:

item.title: Roisin Conaty (live @ The BFI) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #60
item.itunes:title: Roisin Conaty (live @ The BFI) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #60
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the wonderful comedian, writer and panelshow superstar ROISIN CONATY!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the wonderful comedian, writer and panelshow superstar ROISIN CONATY!


This one was recorded LIVE on location at the BFI, at the Southbank in London - were you there? Maybe you were! What a killer show it was… Well, thankfully the goodness from that very night was captured in 1s and 0s all for your listening enjoyment in the event that you were unable to attend (or indeed if you want to relive the occasion) - a great show from start to end, as Brett and Roisin throw down about all things film, life and more - hear all about it, from Roisin’s show ‘Gameface’, to her wet hair napping exploits, to tricky animal films and the trouble within, problems with the film Cocktail, Pat Sharpe haircuts and the thrill of a film’s writing when you can’t ‘hear the typewriter’. Greatness and glory throughout - a fun ride, so strap in and go have fun!


EPISODE LINKS:

item.title: Ruben Fleischer • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #59
item.itunes:title: Ruben Fleischer • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #59
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the fabulous producer, writer, director and developer RUBEN FLEISCHER!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the fabulous producer, writer, director and developer RUBEN FLEISCHER!


A huge, packed, top to bottom festival of movietime aceness for you this week - I mean EVERY week is just that - but PARTICULARLY this week as the director of Zombieland (and the forthcoming sequel) and Venom casually swings by to drop all manner of cinema science on us… He is of course responsible for so much more viewing pleasure than just those three but that’s a fine place to kick things off. He and Brett get down to the cinema chat right away (though with a very ‘Trading Places’ style buildup to the actual podcast - you’ll hear), with a good rundown of what Ruben has been responsible for and the greater subjects of the spirit of invention, and hammering out ideas, as well as the said forthcoming Zombieland 2, the love of John Landis and how American Werewolf In London was no small influence on one film in particular (which you shall find out), the equal love of Rob Reiner, his obscene crying and how he balances out his wife’s somewhat more low-key tear production, and some incredible behind the scenes Borat gossip which you won’t want to miss… Proper business this week. GET INVOLVED.


EPISODE LINKS:

• RUBEN on IMDB!

• ZOMBIELAND!

• ZOMBIELAND 2!

• VENOM!


• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on TWITTER!

• BRETT on INSTAGRAM!

• BRETT on PATREON!

item.title: Barunka O'Shaughnessy • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #58
item.itunes:title: Barunka O'Shaughnessy • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #58
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with glorious performer, writer, comedian and producer BARUNKA O’SHAUGHNESSY!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with glorious performer, writer, comedian and producer BARUNKA O’SHAUGHNESSY!


An absolute multi-threat right here, folks - Barunka is out there making moves on all levels and you are about to hear about ALL of it! All via the medium of film, of course… And what a selection this week - my my, some true obscure treats here and a lot to add to your ‘to watch’ lists (if you haven’t already). She and Brett go into it all, from the back in the days to the right up to now and of course, afterlife, including her being very much behind the scenes, her loving films from an early age when everything in the household stopped for a movie, flashbacks of Czech movies and her early days which includes so many fascinating chapters in her early days growing up in communist Czech Republic (gold lies within - it’s fascinating) and how similar to the film ‘Cold War’ it all is, the Czech new wave, how great the selection is (which you’ll surely be nodding in agreement over!), sex scenes, defocusing her young eyes in order to watch scary films as a young’un, how ‘stupid’ holds up and sattire generally dates, and her being pregnant in the filming of the movie ‘Ghoul’! So much. A true hearty banquet of an episode. Get you some!


EPISODE LINKS:

• BARUNKA on THE INTERNET!

• BARUNKA on IMDB!

item.title: Jamie Demetriou • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #57
item.itunes:title: Jamie Demetriou • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #57
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with hilarious character actor and all round heavyweight funny man JAMIE DEMETRIOU!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with hilarious character actor and all round heavyweight funny man JAMIE DEMETRIOU!


Be prepared for another smash this week, as Brett and Jamie get into some right mischief beginning with how alike they look (and all ensuing comparisons), the investment of grief into the final euphoria of making ‘the thing’ (whatever ‘the thing’ may be), future plans and the years ahead, season 2 of Stath Lets Flats (which is already causing Jamie grief!), how his pocket money was spent almost entirely in Video Viking, hubbubs and hullaballoos, playing as a kid - what even is it and what are we DOING here?, being a cool kid and rejecting horror films, the fun of watching his dad reacting to films, digital vs analog effects, derivative and non-derivative and all manner of deep tangents and heavy philosophising! Excellence for you this week - you’re gonna enjoy this like crazy…


EPISODE LINKS:

• JAMIE on TWITTER!

item.title: Rhys James • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #56
item.itunes:title: Rhys James • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #56
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with Mock The Week-er and all round comedy treasure RHYS JAMES!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by Mock The Week-er and all round comedy treasure RHYS JAMES!


…or is it Rhys Jones? ALL SHALL BE REVEALED. A great one this week as Brett and Rhys get into all things existential and not so much, including his many Mock The Week appearances (and the amount of weeks that have not been mocked by him), meercat vibes, his crying ability and how he is not as adept with horror, how he relates to films about childhood and specific characters within, a brief parental split and hangovers. Oh, and so much more! Just don’t let the face, voice or attitude fool you - he did NOT go to private school. ENJOY!

item.title: January Jones • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #55
item.itunes:title: January Jones • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #55
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the acting phenomenon who you will surely have seen and loved in any one of her tremendous appearances - it’s JANUARY JONES!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the acting phenomenon who you will surely have seen and loved in any one of her tremendous appearances - yes, it’s JANUARY JONES!


A truly huge one this week, people - well worth waiting for too, as January takes to the show with ease and grace and gets right on in from the ground floor! Of course, you will surely know January from arguably one of the top three television shows of all time Mad Men, in which she played Betty Draper, but she has putting in power moves and all kinds of work since (and obviously before) that show - a lot of which you will hear about on this episode! So settle in and enjoy this delightful show where she and Brett cover the whole death thing of course, as well as how they met in a not so great bowling game, her old show ‘Huff’, her dogs getting familiar with Brett (as you’ll hear by way of mic rumble here and there!), the left and right side of the brain and spirituality / mortality, her early days in a small Dakota town and being mom-shamed in a cinema. Perfect from start to end. You will love it. Enjoy January Jones!


AUDIO NOTE! From 18:25 to 22:35 there is a slight drop in quality. This is where we had to resort to the backup recording while a little problem was fixed in-flight. Just in case you notice a little bit that sounds different!


EPISODE LINKS:

• JANUARY on INSTAGRAM!

• JANUARY on IMDB!

• MAD MEN!

item.title: James McNicholas • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #54
item.itunes:title: James McNicholas • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #54
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the Arsenal loving sketch comedian podcaster himself JAMES McNICHOLAS!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the Arsenal loving sketch comedian blogger podcaster champion JAMES McNICHOLAS!


A good old fashioned friendly one this week, as Brett and James catch up and reminisce, but also cover some intriguing, sometimes serious but always funny ground… The fun never goes far from Self Deprecation Island, so have no fear! Hear about it all, from James’s involvement with the Beasts sketch group, what it is to be a sketch comedian, the many differences between being a standup and a storyteller, his world champion boxer grandfather upon whom James’s one man show is based (premiering in Edinburgh, details below!), ‘Arseblog’ and going to Arsenal games alone, some heartbreaking tales from childhood, issues with food and not having a functioning “Full” valve, reasons for having children, seeing Jesus, and witches and giants! It’s an episode which contains multitudes, people. You shall enjoy!


DO SEE 'JAMES McNICHOLAS: THE BOXER' @ Edinburgh Fringe!


EPISODE LINKS:

• JAMES on TWITTER!

• ARSECAST!

• BOXER!


• FILMS TO BE BURIED WITH LIVE @ MARLOWE THEATRE, CANTERBURY, THURSDAY 25th JULY!

item.title: Claudia O'Doherty • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #53
item.itunes:title: Claudia O'Doherty • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #53
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the glorious ad hilarious writer, actor and comedian CLAUDIA O’DOHERTY!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the hilarious and brilliant writer, actor and comedian CLAUDIA O’DOHERTY!


Such a great full length sit down chat with Brett and Claudia for you here, as we hear from the two about all of it. Every single nugget of goodness. From her Australian origins right up to the timid introductions between she and Brett, to her ace appearances and writing on the hit Netflix sitcom ‘Love’, to the secrecy of Netflix and how they simply won’t give up the facts and figures even if you were on the show, getting “the button” in a film and the importance thereof (including her said button in 'Long Shot'), ‘choc tops’ (and how you will more than likely be looking for them when you hear what they are), the world of Stephen King and being no more than two “Are you okay?”s away from a tearflood. Is that all? Oh good god no. You’d be sorely mistaken for thinking that. It’s lovely and you’ll dig the hell out of this episode so set aside some time for yourself and enjoy properly!


EPISODE LINKS:

• CLAUDIA on TWITTER!

• SARAH'S CHANNEL!

• Her COMEDY BLAPS!

• LONG SHOT!

item.title: Asim Chaudhry (live @ Brighton Podcast Festival) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #52
item.itunes:title: Asim Chaudhry (live @ Brighton Podcast Festival) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #52
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe LIVE (at the time) at the Brighton Podcast Festival with ASIM CHAUDHRY of People Just Do Nothing! You’ll love it.
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined LIVE (at the time) at the Brighton Podcast Festival by ASIM CHAUDHRY of the hit show ‘People Just Do Nothing’!


Pure hilarity and insight from start to end, as the two hit the ground running and get down to serious film, comedy and television business… You’ll be party to the whole damn thing (mmm minus some ‘circle of trust’ elements, you understand!), including how they met on a David Hasselhoff-based project, the madness of Black Mirror: Bandersnatch (which he was on), the perils of success by way of loneliness, having married-up family-starting friends, love in an Uber-pool and a resulting show premise, Tupac, Terry the video shop guy (rest in peace to him and also his shop ‘Terry’s Visuals’), being shaken up by a truly mad experience in the woods, carefree days of going to a film school in the US and the insane passport drama that resulted, big screen headaches, Bollywood romance and the origins of People Just Do Nothing! ALSO - a killer Q&A with the awesome audience. Do get ever so involved!


• NOTE! So as you can hear, this was recorded live. At the live shows, there are always visuals pertaining to the films mentioned, so bear in mind that on occasion here the film was brought up when Brett was asking the question. Hence the speedy reaction. No biggy - just thought I’d mention it!


EPISODE LINKS:

• Asim on Twitter!

• People Just Do Nothing!

• Bandersnatch!

• Hoff The Record!

item.title: Chris Martin • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #51
item.itunes:title: Chris Martin • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #51
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with UK to LA comedian and writer CHRIS MARTIN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the UK born LA living comedian and director CHRIS MARTIN!


No he is NOT in Coldplay. How dare you. This is a perfect opportunity to get yourself well acquainted and full immersed into the world of the hilarious Chris, as he and Brett get on down with their bad selves and tackle everything from the differences between the UK and LA (turns out there are many), driving, making and saying vows at a wedding as well as the importance of using the groom’s correct name in said ceremony, the act of going to the cinema, the power of “WWWHHHYYYYYYYYYY!!?!?”, the equal power of “NNNOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!?!”, the phenomenon of Taken and the wonder of Neason, being a cryer and a jumper, ’Sensai Keith’, sex on film and right up to the erotic draw of rabbits. Don’t try and make sense of that last one. All will become clear in the fullness of time. Please enjoy!


EPISODE LINKS:

• CHRIS on TWITTER!

• The BABYSITTING TREVOR podcast!

item.title: Miranda Cosgrove • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #50
item.itunes:title: Miranda Cosgrove • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #50
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the truly excellent actor, star of School Of Rock and all round fabulous person MIRANDA COSGROVE!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the truly excellent actor, School Of Rock star and all round fabulous person MIRANDA COSGROVE!


Can you believe that this is her first ever podcast? It seems crazy as she is a complete natural but it’s true! It’s a genuine treat to hear her many stories revolving around her film picks, and you can be sure that it’s a fascinating, heartwarming and at times very crazy ride… She and Brett actually shared some acting time together on a pilot created by former FTBBW guest Bill Lawrence too! So please, enjoy this wonderful get together as she and Brett discuss how she is a comedy surgeon, her being approached by acting talent scouts at the tender age of 3, the days on the set of unanimous favourite School Of Rock (go watch it again, you will never regret a repeat viewing of that!), popularity after Drake & Josh, I Carlie, the transition from child star to fully grown up, homeschooling, thwarted first kisses and a situation involving her favourite film which is worthy of a film in itself. Prepare to be open mouthed in surprise. Lovely stuff and an all round comforting episode right here - please enjoy!


EPISODE LINKS:

• MIRANDA on INSTAGRAM!

• MIRANDA on TWITTER!

item.title: Steen Raskopoulos • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #49
item.itunes:title: Steen Raskopoulos • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #49
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the incredibly funny comedian and improviser STEEN RASKOPOULOS!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the incredibly funny comedian and improviser from Australia, it’s STEEN RASKOPOULOS!


A lovely episode, as Brett and Steen get into it like good old fashioned pally pals from the get go. It also helps that Steen is a very warm and friendly presence, which you will certainly enjoy throughout the episode! A great chance to get to know him, and most definitely to get to know his film favourites (and non-favourites), and hear about all of it, the whole story which includes his watching of many, many films on places (flying back and forth to Australia, see - you can cram in a ton), the resulting AALS (Altitude Adjusted Lachrimosity Syndrome - that is, crying easily at films on planes), his cricketing past which includes bowling out Alistair Cooke, his drinking sprees in those early cricketing days (ohh, those out of hand cricketers!), his very generous death scenario, skating accidents, how to make it through a horror film successfully, playing sports to playing theatre sports, the correct pronunciation of ‘Bowie’ (you may be surprised), and how films get invented and how tough that is. It’s got it all, people. You shan’t be disappointed.


EPISODE LINKS:

• STEEN on TWITTER!

• STEEN ONLINE!

• STEEN's IMPROV GROUP 'THE BEAR PACK'!

item.title: Jamie Lee • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #48
item.itunes:title: Jamie Lee • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #48
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the glorious comedian, actor, writer and podcaster JAMIE LEE!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the hilarious and awesome comedian, writer, actor and podcaster JAMIE LEE!


Brett’s been taking care of business out in LA for a few months, and as such has managed to get some heavyweight podcasts in the armoury as you will have witnessed recently and will witness in the future, and this week it is the turn of the always fantastic Jamie! You may have seen her online, or indeed on TV/film, but if not this is a perfect primer and certainly grounds for making Jamie your new friend. She was recently a major part of the Pete Holmes / Judd Apatow HBO series ‘Crashing’, but have a peep at her IMDB for some further gold nuggets of goodness. Brett has only been working with Jamie for a good 7 weeks, but they are already fast friends which, as discussed, was sped along by seeing each others’ standup sets, so along with a myriad of excellent in depth film picks you can hear all about Jamie’s incredible fantasy death scenario, problematic mermaids and a whole world more. ENJOY! You shall!


EPISODE LINKS:

• JAMIE on TWITTER!

• JAMIE's PODCAST 'I COULDN'T HELP BUT WONDER'!

item.title: Suzi Ruffell • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #47
item.itunes:title: Suzi Ruffell • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #47
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the fabulous comedian, actor, writer and podcaster SUZI RUFFELL!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by properly fabulous comedian, actor, writer and podcast SUZI RUFFELL!


A perfect chance right here to get in on some classics and a whole world of glorious tangents with Brett and the awesome Suzi, as they catch up like good old pals RIGHT IN FRONT OF US - but of course we get front row seats and you’ll be ever so thankful we did. Suzi has been in the game for a minute, and chances are you will have caught her on TV or hopefully managed to hit up one of her standup shows - her tour is looking healthy for the last half of the year so you’ll surely have a chance to get in some Suzi time very soon… Anyway - the podcast! If you’re easily spooked out then you might want to listen to this in daylight as she and Brett trade a couple of super eerie ghost stories (this is the podcast for it, right?), her thoughts on horror and gore, the representation of queer characters and the storylines which often come with that and a true showstopper of a story involving her dad going to prison in Italy. It’s as insane and amazing as you imagine… Maybe more so… So enjoy this week’s episode with the great and grand SUZI RUFFELL!


EPISODE LINKS:

• SUZI on THE INTERNET!

• SUZI on TWITTER!
