item.title: Richard Shepard • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #46
item.itunes:title: Richard Shepard • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #46
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with all star writer and director RICHARD SHEPARD!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by all star writer and director (of, most recently, Netflix’s ‘The Perfection’), RICHARD SHEPARD!


What a treat! A rare one right here, as Richard isn’t running around doling out his precious time to just anyone making film podcasts… Prepare to be regaled with some wonderful anecdotes and true insider gossip, all from a veteran who has served MANY years on set and behind the scenes. It comes as no surprise then that he is steeped in film knowledge and love, which shall become evident as he and Brett get into it all including his new film ‘The Perfection’ which is out now on Netflix, his writing of many pilots along the way and the mechanics of the pilot world, his crucial parts played in the development of Criminal Minds and Ugly Betty (to name a mere two), his involvement in Girls and collaborating closely with Lena Dunham, how Netflix will often do the publicity run after a film’s release and not before, his formative film education through his father who was a film buff but also need distractions, having real life physical effects on screen over CGI and a wealth of fun and scams working in a New York cinema. A brilliant one here, entertaining and engaging throughout - go peep The Perfection now! And Tokyo Project! LIGHTS OUT!!!


EPISODE LINKS:

• RICHARD SHEPARD on IMDB!

• THE PERFECTION!

• TOKYO PROJECT!


• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on TWITTER!

• BRETT on INSTAGRAM!

item.title: Dave Hill (Game Of Thrones writer) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #45
item.itunes:title: Dave Hill (Game Of Thrones writer) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #45
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with GAME OF THRONES writer DAVE HILL!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the film loving and joyful Game Of Thrones writer DAVE HILL!


“If you’re expecting a happy ending, you haven’t been paying attention…”


…and what kind of cruel world would this be if there wasn’t a liberal sprinkling of proper insider GoT talk, hmmm? Of course as you will know by now, spoilers for the film talk will occur sometimes without warning, but rest assured there are no finale ruiners or loose talk here my friends. You are in safe hands. Just some good, healthy behind the scenes trivia and gossip, very interesting stuff for the heads. You’ll love it. This is all without first saying that this is Dave’s podcast debut! So you’re in for DOUBLE treats here, folks - a chance to catch up and acquaint yourself with the man, as well as get into his past and present with Brett! From his early days wanting to be an astrophysicist, to catching that GoT gig, his monk-like study of the George R R Martin books, the four simple words of advice he received on the first day (“Don’t f*ck it up”), catching up on TV greats later on in life, his love of all things Disney, averting his eyes at sexy scenes and the mechanics of intimate scenes on GoT, higher learning in the US and good lord just about everything in between. Game Of Thrones appreciator or not - you’re in for many treats here, so please enjoy the warm light of DAVE HILL!


EPISODE LINKS:

• DAVE's GAME OF THRONES WIKI!

item.title: Tom Basden • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #44
item.itunes:title: Tom Basden • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #44
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with award winning writer and actor TOM BASDEN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the award winningly great writer and actor TOM BASDEN!


What a world of goodies you’ve got ahead of you… A lovely chat with Tom and Brett recorded on location at Number 42, London (DAMMIT I just gave the address away - too late to delete it too) with a sleeping baby up above in the upstairs quarters. A whole ton of cinema jibber jabber as per usual which rides that undulating roller coaster of fun and good times to the proper grit and dirt of every day life and all that entails. You’ll hear about Tom’s relation to the afterlife since becoming a father, and how that inevitably altered his perspective on life and death, the big difference between gore and horror and how he gets along with such films and a wonderfully heartwarming tale of sleeping with his then girlfriend now wife at the BFI (actually literally sleeping, not in that way you filthy thing you). Tom’s credits run deep, having involvement in so many shows from After Life to The Wrong Mans to Plebs to David Brent: Life On The Road and an immense amount more, so you’re certainly in perfect hands - so step up, look alive and get yourself into episode 44 of Films To Be Buried With!


EPISODE LINKS:

item.title: Punkie Johnson • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #43
item.itunes:title: Punkie Johnson • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #43
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the glorious comedian and podcaster PUNKIE JOHNSON!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the glorious comedian, podcaster PUNKIE JOHNSON!


Brett and Punkie met a good while ago at a gig, where Brett was completely won over by Punkie’s whirlwind of awesomeness, and now the two are able to finally sit down and get some good, honest film chat done up! If you are yet unacquainted with her and her comedy, this is an awesome chance to become a fan and make a new friend, as Brett gets into every aspect of the life of Punkie through her film choices, including her home of New Orleans, being raised non-‘holy poley moley’, the secrets of a happy marriage, the conundrum of open relationships, her bartending days, being the eldest and youngest in a family, running a relationship like a dictatorship, having parents in the police force, Angela Bassett arms and FINALLY a perfect response to the infamous ‘sexiest movie’ sub-category! You the know one I’m talking about. Yeah that one. So please, sit yerself down all comfy like and enjoy the greatness of Punkie!


EPISODE LINKS:

• PUNKIE on TWITTER!

• PUNKIE on INSTAGRAM!

• PUNKIE on THE COMEDY STORE PODCAST!

• PUNKIE on the HOMOPHILIA podcast!


• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on TWITTER!

• BRETT on INSTAGRAM!

• BRETT on PATREON!

• 'SUPERBOB' - Brett's 2015 feature film!

• 'CORNERBOYS' with BRETT & SCROOBIUS PIP!


• DISTRACTION PIECES NETWORK on FACEBOOK

• DISTRACTION PIECES NETWORK on INSTAGRAM

item.title: Andy Nyman • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #42
item.itunes:title: Andy Nyman • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #42
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the tremendous actor, writer and director ANDY NYMAN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the tremendous actor, writer and director ANDY NYMAN!


…so as we bid Andy a hearty ‘olav-ha-sholom’ as he meets his fictional podcast afterlife here with Brett, let’s get a proper dig into his life through film - and as a fully fledged film maker and actor, you can be sure it’s a brilliant lineup. Brett sits down with Andy in his dressing room as he waits stage call for his current role in ‘Fiddler On The Roof’, and they really get into things from the get go, including his sincere love of acting (which most definitely comes through) and ability to make choices that work for him, the British Jewish experience, mad childhood experiences in the cinema, directing and starring in Ghost Stories as well as the incredibly received stage show, the band Goblin, how Richard Dreyfuss pretty much single-handedly got him into acting, how Asian horrors share a lot with the British character, revisiting techy films years after, being a softy in later years, a thumbs down to superhero films and how physical effects win over CGI every time. So much going on - so get started right away, you’ll love this one!


EPISODE LINKS:

• ANDY on TWITTER!

• FIDDLER ON THE ROOF!

• GHOST STORIES film!

• GHOST STORIES stage show!


• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on TWITTER!

• BRETT on INSTAGRAM!

• BRETT on PATREON!

• 'SUPERBOB' - Brett's 2015 feature film!

• 'CORNERBOYS' with BRETT & SCROOBIUS PIP!

item.title: Lolly Adefope (live @ The BFI) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #41
item.itunes:title: Lolly Adefope (live @ The BFI) • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #41
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the awesomely hilarious comedian and actor LOLLY ADEFOPE!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the awesomely hilarious comedian and actor LOLLY ADEFOPE!


“Maybe that’s the point…”


NOT ONLY THAT! This whole meeting takes place LIVE within the plush confines of the South Bank’s BFI! This is the second live Films To Be Buried With so far, and it’s a smash for real, as Lolly is a true treat and a really great time! There’s a lot of ground covered in this action packed episode, including how she SINGLE HANDEDLY broke Tom Cruise’s ankle (well, I mean, kind of), her upcoming series ‘Shrill’ (aka DJ Shrill-Ex) and her imminent super-stardom as a result of it, how her attention span for films has been impinged upon through television, the regrets of actors, spitty kisses and ever so much more! What a goodie. One thing to remember before going in - the safeword is ‘Neeson’. You may need it. ENJOY!


EPISODE LINKS:

• LOLLY on TWITTER!

• LOLLY ON INSTAGRAM!

• MISSION IMPOSSIBLE: FALLOUT!

• SHRILL!

• 'OBSESSED WITH LINE OF DUTY' podcast!


• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on TWITTER!

item.title: Mark Kermode • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #40
item.itunes:title: Mark Kermode • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #40
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the mayor of the multiplex, the prince of the picturehouse - it’s MARK KERMODE!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by author, film critic royalty and Wittertainment champ MARK KERMODE!


“…All the best stuff I’ve seen tends to have been stuff I’ve known nothing about until it starts…”


This is the one you’ve been waiting for, ladies and gentlemen - a proper sit down with Mark, this time joined NOT by Simon Mayo, but by Brett Goldstein! This is Films To Be Buried With perfection, as anyone with even a passing interest in cinema has surely fallen in love with Mark’s podcasts and books, and it’s such a great chance to hear him talk at length about those favourites of his along with a healthy dose of sprinkled in gems and treasures from his life in film criticism. From being a fan of cold water swimming (I hope Mark is familiar with Wim Hof, that’s a team up waiting to happen), to The Exorcist (a lifelong obsession), to crying in cinemas, to meeting his wife aka “the good lady professor her indoors”, to the fetishistic act of loading a film onto a projector, to old cinemas, and ultimate salvation through film. This is everything you expected and more - you’ll love it, so settle in and enjoy - and get ready to take some notes too, you’ll definitely have a few recommendations lined up after this one…

(PS Hello to Jason Isaacs)


EPISODE LINKS:

• MARK on TWITTER!

• KERMODE & MAYO FILM REVIEWS!

• KERMODE ON FILM podcast!

• MARK's LATEST BOOK 'How Does It Feel'!

item.title: Camille Ucan • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #39
item.itunes:title: Camille Ucan • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #39
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the wonderfully great comedian (standup and sketch), actor and podcaster CAMILLE UCAN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the wonderfully great comedian (sketch, standup, all sides), actor and podcaster CAMILLE UCAN!


If you don’t already know Camille, prepare to make your newest friend by the end of this as she is a true diamond guest! You may have made her acquaintance as part of sketch comedy crew ‘The Birthday Girls’, alongside Beattie Edmonson and Rose Johnson, or perhaps you’ve seen her in Lee & Dean (among tons of other appearances), but here’s a perfect chance to hear her film picks and get deep into the existential madness that is life itself. Amidst the good times you will get to hear about Camille’s death anxieties (which are triggered by films, making her the true perfect guest on this podcast!), her times staying with Brett up in Edinburgh during Fringe times, her tolerance to horror which she does not share with her husband by any means, whether her singing is up to par with Brett’s movement (including a Curb Your Enthusiasm-worthy audition story) and how she doesn’t watch films twice. There is so much more besides of course, and you will enjoy the hell out of this one. Ladies and gentlemen, Camille Ucan!


EPISODE LINKS:

• CAMILLE ONLINE!

• CAMILLE on TWITTER!

• THE BIRTHDAY GIRLS!

• THE BIRTHDAY GIRLS HOUSE PARTY PODCAST!

item.title: Funmbi Omotayo • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #38
item.itunes:title: Funmbi Omotayo • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #38
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the fantastic comedian FUNMBI OMOTAYO!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the wonderful comedian FUNMBI OMOTAYO!


“Comedy is my calling - what I do with my comedy is the purpose…”


A really enjoyable and uplifting episode with the radiant Funmbi, who is pretty much universally regarded as an all round nice guy - and this episode should only serve as evidence of this! However, as we hear, the nice guy image can be tough to break out of, especially in the world of standup. He and Brett get deep into this of course, but you can expect some full on entertaining film chatter as well as comedy nuggets and gems, including Funmbi’s beginnings in comedy and developing his comedic chops for all kinds of rooms and environments, living in Nigeria at an early age and being involved in film clubs which, at that time, was all about VHS tapes, how one must commit to one’s VHS renting choice whereas in streaming you can jump around, attending drama school in Canada, not being into horror and opting more for the superhero side of things, relatable bad guys and SO MUCH MORE! It’s proper jam packed, and Funmbi’s led a crazy interesting life so you’ll definitely get down with this one, ladies and gentlemen. The nice guy of comedy, Funmbi Omotayo!


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

• FUNMBI ONLINE!

• FUNMBI on TWITTER!

• FUNMBI in THE GUARDIAN!

item.title: John Robins • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #37
item.itunes:title: John Robins • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #37
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with comedian, podcaster and presenter JOHN ROBINS!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by comedian, podcaster and presenter JOHN ROBINS!


Lots of good times to be had with Brett and John, which is all right here for your listening enjoyment! John is well into his films, so much so he has a long list of Kermode’s recommendations at hand (a wise move - maybe throw some suggestions at him yourself why not!) and has a fine history of film watching as you will hear. So as the two approach a good amount of conversational bits and pieces including the locked grooves of being a film critic, the many problems of HD and the effect it has on the feel of a film, to him being a very solutions oriented fellow, to all kinds of tangents besides, you’ll have a great old time in the company of John Robins - enjoy! Oh, and when you hear a sound almost like an old phonograph record or a roasting chicken, it’s just John vaping. We didn’t add extra foley effects. Although that would be kinda fun…?


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

item.title: Jameela Jamil • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #36
item.itunes:title: Jameela Jamil • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #36
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with actor, comedian, writer, presenter, model and activist JAMEELA JAMIL!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by national treasure, actor, comedian, writer, presenter, model and activist JAMEELA JAMIL!


“You’re giving people a timeout from their lives, and sucking them into fantasy, and that’s so noble to me…”


An incredible chat session with Brett and Jameela, and definitely one which really displays the essence of what Films To Be Buried With is all about. Life, death, cinema. And who better to talk about such subjects as an actor on a show about the afterlife! From her humble beginnings back in the days working in a video shop (complete with a well stocked ice-cream fridge), to presenting a music show on Channel 4 to then getting into comedy, and now full on acting in ‘The Good Place’ and more, she’s also become a very powerful voice in the world of activism with her amazing positive campaigning against the weird world of celebrity diets, fat-shaming and many other vile elements in mass media. Basically Jameela is a superhero living among us. So let us celebrate her, as we hear about her show The Good Place and being on the cusp of series 4, Ted Danson, the costs of activism and balancing the benefits, how it seems the world has been listening to her since she lost weight, karma, the afterlife, ET-based grief therapy and what Macaulay Culkin has to answer for in her fear of bees (and what scrapes said fear has gotten her into). Glorious! ENJOY!


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

• JAMEELA on TWITTER!

• JAMEELA on INSTAGRAM!

• THE GOOD PLACE!

• The I WEIGH movement!


• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on TWITTER!

item.title: Bill Lawrence • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #35
item.itunes:title: Bill Lawrence • Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #35
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with director, producer, screenwriter and show runner BILL LAWRENCE!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by director, producer, screenwriter and show runner BILL LAWRENCE!


“Everything goes my way…”


A truly enjoyable chat with Bill, who - as you’ll hear - is responsible a great chunk of amazing US television from the past few decades. From Spin City to Scrubs, Clone High to Cougar Town and his newest creation Whiskey Cavalier, you’ll find Bill’s name in there proud and centre. As ever, the sit down convo enjoys many a tangent, ranging from some ‘inside baseball’ details, Brett’s casting in a Bill creation pilot a while back, the character board and the dynamics of a cast, his additional work as puncher up of scripts, the deep connection between him and his father, the old chestnut of separating art from the artist and whether we can do that these days (often, no), the two sources of comedy, the duality of his parents backgrounds, the occasionally manipulative nature of Scrubs and a whole lot more. Brilliant stuff, a bubbly and enjoyable gem of an episode! KARAOKE MAN, WHERE YOU BEEN?!?!


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

• WHISKEY CAVALIER!

item.title: Russian Doll's Leslye Headland - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #34
item.itunes:title: Russian Doll's Leslye Headland - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #34
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with director, writer and actor (and co-creator of Netflix’s Russian Doll), it’s LESLYE HEADLAND!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by actor, writer, director (and co-creator of Netflix’s Russian Doll) - it’s LESLYE HEADLAND!


"Gotta get up, gotta get out, gotta get home before the moooooorning comes…"


So did you do your homework as set for you last week, hmmm? You had ONE JOB! As easy one, if you have a Netflix subscription - yes that one job was to watch Russian Doll, so hopefully that was an achievable task and was taken care of! If so, you will have of course become a fast fan, and you will thoroughly enjoy Brett and Leslye going right into it - a proper treasure trove of trivia for you, going into the logistics, casting, music (yes THAT song), the whole deal. It’s fascinating even if you haven’t seen it though - you’ll get a kick out of it for sure! On top of that, the two go in on how Leslye is open to her creations being interpreted however they may (unless it’s wrong), her dreams of directing a Bond movie, toxic femininity, being put in her feelings by one film in particular, how she loves musicals (apart from one - you’ll hear), how key moments in her life seemed to be centred around film, sexy vs sexist, her early films and her family’s new year’s film traditions! ALSO - treat yourself to the Patreon only moments for this week only, as Brett loved them so much he decided to give you a taste for free…


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

item.title: Chris Hewitt (Empire Magazine) - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #33
item.itunes:title: Chris Hewitt (Empire Magazine) - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #33
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with Empire Magazine’s very own CHRIS HEWITT!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the celebrated Empire Magazine writer CHRIS HEWITT!


A surprisingly mischievous episode at that, my my… All fun and games though, as Brett and Chris get down and dirty and give you the goods on all angles of cinema and film criticism, including his way to the magazine itself, his exceedingly accurate review of Brett’s film Superbob, how the whole film industry should take a year off so we can all catch up, his awfully embarrassing made-up death scenario, his early days of film-making (described in about as high a level of self-deprecation as you can get), his emotional uncorking after some very personal and close death experiences, and how his partner does not share his love of horror films by any means. Such an enjoyable one this, so please, have fun getting to know Chris!

(NOTE! Hereditary spoiler at around 41 minutes or so... Be alert!)


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

• EMPIRE MAGAZINE PODCAST!

item.title: Athena Kugblenu - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #32
item.itunes:title: Athena Kugblenu - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #32
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the brilliant comedian and writer ATHENA KUGBLENU!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the awesome comedian and writer ATHENA KUGBLENU!


Surely one of the most hardcore Films To Be Buried With guests at that, as Athena is mere days after giving birth - that’s some solid dedication to the craft of podcasting right there! And we are blessed by her golden presence, as Brett sets things off proper from the get go, which provides us with gem after gem including her brand new motherhood role, attending the cinema with her then unborn baby and working out what it responded to, how she enjoys her horror movies with a cup of sweet tea at the end (that’s actually a perfect combo) and SO much more… How much more? Well, the question “What in the world happened to Billy Zane?” gets posed, and also Athena makes Brett very angry - why, you may ask? Oh… You’ll find out… While films get spoiled all over the shop in the podcast, this writeup is a spoiler-free zone, people. ENJOY ATHENA!

item.title: Matthew Crosby - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #31
item.itunes:title: Matthew Crosby - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #31
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the hilarious comedian and writer MATTHEW CROSBY!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the hilarious comedian, writer and ensemble player MATTHEW CROSBY!


It’s a super deluxe Valentine’s Day gem for you all this week, and with that spirit of love in the air for all, be you with a significant other or otherwise, you will have a perfectly charming and very funny time this week with Matthew and Brett. Enjoy this sit down chat with the fellas as they go in on everything, including Matthew’s film education via the VHS-based “shit Blockbusters” of his film school (and the warmth of watching film taped off telly), how meta his death is, the holding of his dad’s hand during a film (a thoroughly lovely moment), being a jack of many trades including teacher, misinterpreting films, how to not return to the ‘lit firework’ of sexiness experienced as a younger man (it’ll make sense in the fullness of time, just listen!), 20% shame, double double shame and a glorious engagement story! It’s all here. You’ll love it. Enjoy Matthew Crosby!


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

item.title: Sean McLoughlin - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #30
item.itunes:title: Sean McLoughlin - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #30
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the brilliant writer and comedian SEAN McLOUGHLIN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the wonderful comedian and writer SEAN McLOUGHLIN!


Prepare yourself for some good time podcastery right here ladies and gentlemen, as Brett sits down and locks eyes with Sean in order to get the goods on his film picks. And you can be quite sure that they are very solid picks indeed! It’s not just those cinematic selections though - we get a good peek behind the curtains of the McLoughlin universe, including his recent shows opening for Ricky Gervais (and playing a number of ‘stadia’, as Brett would have it), how he’s got back into films after having a good break from them (lucky for the podcast!), his views on faith and belief and some very in-depth Moneyball talk. Though in the same way that you don’t have to be a baseball fan to enjoy Moneyball, you certainly don’t have to be a fan of Moneyball to enjoy this podcast. But you will be by the end, I reckon. Anyway - a great one this week folks, please enjoy!


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

item.title: Mandip Gill - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #29
item.itunes:title: Mandip Gill - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #29
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the ex-Hollyoakian Dr Who companion MANDIP GILL!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by ex-Hollyoaks regular and current Dr Who companion, MANDIP GILL!


You may have even caught Mandip on screen with Brett himself in a recent Dr Who episode! A lovely chat with the awesomely funny and always switched on and friendly Mandip, which will energise and invigorate you and surely encourage you to investigate her work further. While a great amount of cinema classics are delved into in usual Films To Be Buried With style and fashion, you can expect to hear so much more including more about Dr Who - what it was like on set and the importance of lightness and humour within the dynamic, how she gets recognized on the street more for Hollyoaks than anything else she’s been in, being the sixth kid of seven, intrusive thought syndrome and what it means for her daily life (and general thoughts on mortality), and on top of that you’ll also get some dry-land swimming lessons. Sound good? Of course it does! Enjoy Mandip Gill!

item.title: Dominic Monaghan - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #28
item.itunes:title: Dominic Monaghan - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #28
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the Lord Of The Rings, Lost, Flashforward heavyweight - DOMINIC MONAGHAN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the heavyweight of TV and cinema - Merry, Charlie, Simon, whoever you might know him as best - it’s DOMINIC MONAGHAN!


A wonderful get together with Brett and Dominic (Lost! Flashforward! Lord Of The Rings! MORE!), as the two get acquainted over life, death and film, and in this case even some plant based hallucinogens. We catch Dom in his hotel room while on a brief break filming the new Star Wars (not being filmed IN his hotel room, you understand), giving he and Brett ample time to get down into subjects such as making the most of his experience filming Star Wars and being present for it, existential crises, ayahuasca and DMT, his father’s botany expertise (which could trickle into Dom’s own plant leanings), being fiercely agnostic, how he is the link in the chain to a lot of blockbuster movies, his meditation practises and gratitude, and how he’s watched The Empire Strikes Back over 200 times. So it’s fitting that he’s starring in that new Star Wars! Excellent stuff, which branches out nicely from cinema but always gets tied up with a neat bow. Enjoy Dominic Monaghan!

item.title: Jessie Cave - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #27
item.itunes:title: Jessie Cave - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #27
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the multi faceted creative diamond JESSIE CAVE!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the vibrant and inspirational energy of creative multi-threat JESSIE CAVE!


THE MOST REQUESTED GUEST IS NOW HERE! A thorough and very satisfying journey through not only her film picks, but also her creative process and life as a whole. You’ll get a very detailed and interesting view of how her personal life feeds into her creative work, and fuels her process which will inspire and motivate you to get cracking on your own projects! Beginning with a nice breakdown of her ’Sunrise’ show, touring in the very near future near you (which you absolutely must see), you’ll hear how in fact Jessie is Brett’s nightmare of a cinema companion (bathroom breaks, chatter and so forth), how she gradually chiselled away at her show and refined it all, the madness of social media which I’m sure we now can all fully relate to, the inner workings of her past relationship and a whole ton more - so much going on, you’ll love it. Get involved - enjoy Jessie Cave!


––––– ––––– –––––

item.title: Films Of 2018 Special with Nish Kumar - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein
item.itunes:title: Films Of 2018 Special with Nish Kumar - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with Nish Kumar - IT’S THE FILMS OF 2018 SPECIAL!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week it’s the FILMS OF 2018 SPECIAL - not only that, the special guest is the wonderful NISH KUMAR!


Yes indeed - Nish is back from the dead, fully resurrected and reanimated and ready to talk films of yesteryear with Brett, and what a selection they have to choose from… It was a tough job for sure but I’m confident you shall enjoy their selections and reasons behind the picks. The only rules are that the films are between the 1st of January and 31st of December 2018, and while this unfortunately automatically disqualified The Favourite (released 1st January 2019), the lists are VERY strong. Through their film choices you’ll also catch a glimpse of how these films affected them personally, as there were a handful of films released in 2018 which truly hit home and hacked into our emotional switchboards in all kinds of ways. Prepare to get emotional, excited, hopefully not angry, but definitely inspired to watch or rewatch these modern day classics! So - live from the very messy flat of Mr Nish Kumar (Brett’s serial killer flat was, ummm, otherwise engaged), please enjoy this thorough and skilfully picked list of cinematic greatness from 2018!


DON'T FORGET! There's a Superbob screening / Q&A (with Brett & Jon Drever) at The David Lean Cinema in Croydon on 15th January!


––––– ––––– –––––

item.title: Stu Whiffen - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #26
item.itunes:title: Stu Whiffen - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #26
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! HAPPY NEW YEAR! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with podcasting maniac and all round good guy STU WHIFFEN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! A very HAPPY NEW YEAR to you and yours! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the prolific podcaster and DJ and all round nice guy STU WHIFFEN!


You may know him from his appearances on Pip’s Distraction Pieces podcast as part of the regular ‘DrunkCast’ episodes with Chris Glasson, or maybe from his own podcast with Chris called ‘Hardcore Listing’, or maybe even his very own podcast called ‘Off The Beat & Track’ - however you know him, here’s your chance to hear him on the other side of the table as Brett gives HIM the grilling this time! A lovely episode, whether you are familiar with Stu or not - and if not, this is a perfect intro and great jump-off to explore his podcast universe! Covering many bases from his problem with Kermit The Frog riding a bike (relatable and understandable, it has to be said), to having the best death yet, to boxing, crying in front of the family, old films and how problematic they can be in the modern climate, the power of musicals if you just go with them a little, and all kinds of fun film chat. Jump in and enjoy! And as always - be excellent to each other. If you are not already being excellent to each other, maybe that’s the new year’s resolution eh?


––––– ––––– –––––

LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

• STU WHIFFEN on TWITTER!

• HARDCORE LISTING podcast!

• OFF THE BEAT & TRACK podcast!

• PODBIBLE!

item.title: Hayley Campbell - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #25
item.itunes:title: Hayley Campbell - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #25
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the amazing writer, podcaster and Empire journalist HAYLEY CAMPBELL!A bli...
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the amazing writer, podcaster and Empire journalist HAYLEY CAMPBELL!


A blissful celebration of cinema and death, and immaculately timed too as Hayley is - at the time of podcasting - writing a book about death AND has had written several powerfully interesting articles about all manner of mortality related subjects. She writes for Empire Magazine too so basically Hayley is the perfect guest for Films To Be Buried With! Enjoy the overflowing awesomeness as the two get down to this whole life and death and film business, getting started on her reasons for not actually going into film production itself (fully understandable and surely infinitely relatable reasons!), her graphic novelist father Eddie Campbell and how he would incorporate her in his own novels from birth to present day (and the ensuing weirdness this brings from some fans), how the book she’s writing about death is slowly messing her up, cremation alternatives and how one can turn one’s self into a bag of white powder after death, Stallone porn and hating your own interests! Oh it’s great, just dive in and enjoy will ya? And of course - be excellent to each other.


––––– ––––– –––––


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

item.title: Films To Be Buried With Christmas Special with Lou Sanders & Brett Goldstein
item.itunes:title: Films To Be Buried With Christmas Special with Lou Sanders & Brett Goldstein
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only the great annual Films To Be Buried With Christmas Special! Surprises, treats, presents, and LOU SANDERS! More? JUST LISTEN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! NOT ONLY THAT - it’s the once a year only CHRISTMAS SPECIAL! What a way to celebrate! Join your host LOU SANDERS as she… Wait hold on… Let me try that again… Join your host LOU SANDERS as… Okay hold up… Something’s going on here… Let me check something…


…well look at that… It seems that this truly IS a Christmas gift to you, the listeners - ladies and gentlemen, the tables have truly turned in here! It’s the long awaited episode where Brett has bought his one way ticket to the great cinema in the sky and must pick his own films to be buried with! And as you may have gathered - yes, the host is LOU SANDERS herself! The episode gatecrasher and incredibly funny lady herself has stormed the studio and grabbed the mic and assumed hosting duties! So all there is for you to do now is to sit back, relax, maybe find someone nearby to cuddle (couldn’t hurt) and enjoy this phenomenal, sensational and absolutely action packed Christmas Special edition of FILMS TO BE BURIED WITH!

OH - and also - enjoy a half hour megamix of music from me, Buddy Peace (producer of this podcast) at the end! MY GIFT TO YOU!


––––– ––––– –––––

item.title: Jon Drever - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #24
item.itunes:title: Jon Drever - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #24
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with old pal and directorial brother JON DREVER!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by one of his good old pals and director of Superbob, Corner Boys and MUCH more, it’s JON DREVER!


The self-described work-wife of Brett, having worked alongside each other for a good amount of years on all kinds of projects, Jon provides a perfect brotherly dynamic right here on Films To Be Buried With - if by brotherly we’re talking about sly digs, anger and an undercurrent of passive-aggressiveness… Just messing, of course! It’s a great one with the two, very much the family get together Christmas episode, and a wonderful opportunity to get to know Jon up close and personal, in the most intimate way - through his cinematic choices! Beginning with a letter from Jon himself, read out by Brett, to foreshadow what’s to come, the two go in on it all - their chemistry, their work together, Jon’s film commandments (take note), him not being good with horrors or teary films, and of course, the much hinted at FURIOUS ANGER of Brett in response to a pick of Jon’s. A treat in itself. We always knew that cool, calm and happy veneer would crack soon, right? PLEASE ENJOY, and a very happy Christmas to you too if you get down with such festivities. Be excellent to each other.


––––– ––––– –––––


LINKS FOR EPISODE 24:

• JON DREVER on TWITTER!

• JON on THE INTERNET!

• SUPERBOB!


• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on TWITTER!

• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on INSTAGRAM!

• 'SUPERBOB' - Brett's 2015 feature film!

• 'CORNERBOYS' with BRETT & SCROOBIUS PIP!


• DISTRACTION PIECES NETWORK on FACEBOOK

• DISTRACTION PIECES NETWORK on INSTAGRAM

item.title: Dane Baptiste - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #23
item.itunes:title: Dane Baptiste - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #23
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with comedian and sharp eyed pop culture sniper DANE BAPTISTE!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by comedian and fully trained sharp-eyed popular culture sniper DANE BAPTISTE!


A few polite words before we begin… And this may shock you to hear…

…but POP CULTURE IS NOT YOUR FRIEND.


Now we have that out of the way, you’re all set to get VERY deep into all kinds of rabbit-holes from where Dane will pluck you and then show you the inner-workings of the matrix that is around us… A fascinating chat, which includes some goodies involving Dane discovering his own creative journey ahead of him, theories on all sorts (death, cinema, culture, the lot), being raised by women and the “boys don’t cry” attitude, hood films, the secrets behind the media, 90’s black stereotypes in film, the importance of representation, guns, martial arts, and just all manner of jewels being strewn around all over the shop. Marvellous. Take your Limitless pills and hold on tight - this is a heavy one! Oh, shoutouts to Showgirls, Wesley Snipes and To Wong Foo too.


––––– ––––– –––––


LINKS FOR EPISODE 23:

• DANE BAPTISTE on TWITTER!

• DANE on THE INTERNET!

• DANE on INSTAGRAM!

• SUNNY D!


• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on TWITTER!

• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on INSTAGRAM!

item.title: Evelyn Mok - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #22
item.itunes:title: Evelyn Mok - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #22
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the Chinese-Swedish comedian raised in India - it’s the wonderful EVELYN MOK!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the Chinese-Swedish comedian raised in India - it’s the all global EVELYN MOK!


A lovely and entertaining look at this whole life, death and afterlife ride with Evelyn, who has some very considered and entertaining perspectives on the whole ordeal along with some really interesting film picks, which are partly informed by her unique upbringing. Recorded during Brett and Evelyn’s respective runs in Edinburgh, this is a bubbly but also cool and calm sit down with the two, who go in on all things comedy, existence, and cinema, including some valuable and informative insights into the way the afterlife is handled in Chinese tradition. Excellent stuff, enjoy episode 22 with Evelyn!


––––– ––––– –––––

item.title: Will Poulter (Live @ The BFI) - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #21
item.itunes:title: Will Poulter (Live @ The BFI) - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #21
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! This week is a LIVE spectacular from the glorious, prestigious BFI! Want more? Well this week Brett is joined by the amazing WILL POULTER!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by one of the UK’s finest in the game, it’s WILL POULTER! Not only that - this week is a live special recorded at the BFI! DOUBLE BONUS!


Hopefully some of of you will have made it down to the excellent day-long podcast festival ‘Podstock’ at the BFI, with a stellar line up of live shows and goodness from start to end. If you didn’t, here’s your chance to catch up on the fun, where the Films To Be Buried With podcast closing out the day’s entertainment in full on grand style! Brett is joined by superstar actor and all round lovely dude Will Poulter, as they get down to the topics of life, death and film, all intercut with some awesome anecdotes and wisdom from Will and general good times had by all. This is basically the entire show, with a few small edits for audio (as, obviously, you can’t see the stage on this podcast - so some things wouldn’t have made a lot of sense without the visuals!), so please, ladies and gentlemen, enjoy this packed show and get to know Will Poulter even better than you did before! Massive shouts to Will for donating his fee to the Parkinson’s Foundation, and of course, to the BFI crew for doing what they do, which is a lot and it’s all amazing. Bless!


––––– ––––– –––––


LINKS FOR EPISODE 21:


• WILL POULTER on TWITTER!

• PARKINSON'S FOUNDATION

item.title: Ricky Gervais - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #20
item.itunes:title: Ricky Gervais - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #20
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the podfather himself - it’s Ricky Gervais!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by all round legend we’ve been waiting for - yes people, it’s RICKY GERVAIS!


Brett’s been hinting at it for a minute now, and the time has finally come - listen with glee as he chops it up with old pal Ricky, who is admittedly nervous at the start as he understand the weight of importance of this podcast ALL TOO WELL. Many have fallen along the way… So he knows what he’s up against. Brett puts him at ease perfectly from the beginning, and the two get down to it launching headfirst into it all, including being at home watching films on a plane, Scandi-love and subtitled programmes, Netflix goodies, pitching a new name for the podcast (’TV Shows To Be Buried With’ - wonder what that would involve…?), the difference between best and favourite, good afterlife chat, early experiences with sadder cinema, fear of guns on set (understandable), how he is the “one-take cryer”, and a world more besides. Enjoy this long chat with Ricky, not often you get to hear him like this and it’s a true pleasure. Listen, enjoy, share, and listen again!


––––– ––––– –––––


LINKS FOR EPISODE 20:


• RICKY GERVAIS on TWITTER!

• RICKY ONLINE!

• DEREK (with Brett Goldstein!)

• HUMANITY on NETFLIX!

• RICKY GERVAIS IS DEADLY SIRIUS!


• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on TWITTER!

item.title: Alistair Green - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #19
item.itunes:title: Alistair Green - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #19
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with comedian and writer and good pal ALISTAIR GREEN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by comedian, writer, and good friend - not to mention favourite stand-up of Brett’s, it’s ALISTAIR GREEN!


No, it is the not the Reverend Al Green, but the very hilarious Alistair, whom Brett has been down with since a good long while ago. So you can expect some good old fashioned dizzy good times from the pair as they get deep into the whole existential mess of cinema and life, with some equally good old fashioned chatter and banter in between. Beginning on the entirely relatable note of hard times at the local cinema - mainly fuelled by members of the public engaging in very non-cinema appropriate behaviour, which progresses into general airing of grievances, we move onto the food chain, aliens and monsters, some sea talk regarding how bloody terrifying it is, PG certificate vs 12, and his hatred of “charming” or “slick” films. If you do not know Alistair, prepare to add him to your new pal list. If you already do, head straight up to the VIP section and ENJOY!


––––– ––––– –––––


LINKS FOR EPISODE 19:


• ALISTAIR GREEN on TWITTER!

item.title: Deborah Frances-White - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #18
item.itunes:title: Deborah Frances-White - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #18
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with comedian/writer/podcaster DEBORAH FRANCES-WHITE!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by comedian, writer, podcaster and MORE, DEBORAH FRANCES-WHITE!


Great times to be had, as Brett and Deborah see their way through a funny, interesting, moving, provocative and far ranging conversation, covering a huge amount of bases including her own podcast ‘The Guilty Feminist’, the complexities of the problematic film Pretty Woman (and more), living on the cusp of showbiz and some good cusp talk, getting her own film made and the importance of having a nice, friendly set, her experience and history as a former Jehova’s Witness, her emotional experiences with film in class as a kid, salvation through Baz Luhrmann, some deep Hitchcock film theory, changing who you are and how to embody that, “I am a feminist but…”, and of course her film ‘Say My Name’! See? Loads. Get yourself some Deborah time in your life.


––––– ––––– –––––


LINKS FOR EPISODE 18:


• DEBORAH FRANCES-WHITE on TWITTER!

• THE GUILTY FEMINIST PODCAST!

item.title: Stu Goldsmith - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #17
item.itunes:title: Stu Goldsmith - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #17
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the megapodcasting comedian STU GOLDSMITH!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the podcasting maniac and pro comic STU GOLDSMITH!


A lovely get together with two full on podcasting folk and standup comedians, talking shop and gossip and all that good stuff but more importantly talking about FILMS! Some great goodness here, as Stu goes very deep into it all… Nostalgia, his love of a good ‘timeloop’ film, how sleepdriving needs a good campaign demonising it (quite right), watching horror films too young (a common theme on this podcast), being on the more emotional side of his family, good old fashioned pirate VHS tapes, his love of the ‘flow’ zone and how greatness can be achieved within, being calm in a crisis but falling apart shortly thereafter and - yes indeed - Kung Fu Panda and lessons learned from it. A good time on this one - please enjoy!


––––– ––––– –––––

item.title: Aisling Bea - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #16
item.itunes:title: Aisling Bea - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #16
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Take a seat and join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the always glorious AISLING BEA!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the wonderful, the always hilarious AISLING BEA!


…or maybe we should call this episode the Brad & Ainsley show…? And why? ALL WILL BE REVEALED! Aisling is absolute podcast gold, and you know she holds it down on any given podcast so it’s a great chance to get into some depth on her film choices here to reveal even more angles. She’s not afraid to get into the woods about the rough stuff either so be prepared to enjoy the dark and the light right here, from her fearless approach to death having talked about it openly from a young age, to her preference over the TV box-set to films (which is why the other alternative title could be ‘TV Box-Sets To Be Buried With’) and her psychological evaluation of this preference, multi tasking while film watching, early and painful date memories, being ace at impressions but not getting the quotes right, how men love to quote - especially Simpsons (very true), how tough it is to act scared or specifically to act scared about something that’s not there, being horrified out of her mind and rightly so by a certain film which doesn’t need publicity here, her early days in a sketch show but having to develop her comic knowledge as she went along, and just a whole ton more - you know it’s a goody, and she and Brett get along lovely so enjoy this one! You surely will!


––––– ––––– –––––

item.title: Nick Helm - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #15
item.itunes:title: Nick Helm - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #15
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Come and join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with the hilarious NICK HELM!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week he is joined by the tremendous, the hilarious - NICK HELM!


A really nice one this week, with Brett and Nick chatting all kinds of goodness about life and cinema, with reflections on what comes in that post-credit sequence we call the afterlife… You are in for all kinds of memories, observations, thoughts and ponderings from the pair, as Nick taps the old mental photo albums and reminisces about his early days hoarding film tickets, learning about film special effects as a kid, theories on life and death and all matters existential, how we relate to a Ghostbusters cast member in different stages of life, seeing ‘video nasties’ at an all too tender age (when IS it a good to watch Texas Chainsaw Massacre?), relating to Wes Anderson characters, some touching talk on father issues and the manifestation of them throughout life, comedy horror and the usual cinema hi-jinx you have come to expect. Enjoy Brett and Nick!


––––– ––––– –––––


THIS WEEK'S LINKS:


• NICK HELM on TWITTER!

item.title: Jayde Adams - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #14
item.itunes:title: Jayde Adams - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #14
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he talks life, death, love and the universe with tremendous comedian JAYDE ADAMS!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week you can expect a truly epic one - this one’s as sad, exciting and nail-biting as Titanic - the guest is the wonderful comedian JAYDE ADAMS!


As funny as it is very moving, this episode has everything you would want in an episode, from the hilarious to the genuinely tear-jerking. Brett and Jayde go in deep on here and don’t take any mercy, as they go through this whole mortality and cinema roller coaster with expert precision and confidence, and come out the other end with a tale to tell and a knowing look that tells it all. From Jayde’s awkwardness as a kid and finding solace in film, to having film in common with her brother who has an entirely different profession, the 11 o’ clock number and exactly what that is, a very moving moment regarding her sister which is heavy but in a very therapeutic way, being a fan of love, controversy over Labyrinth (did I mention it was a roller coaster?), her love of dance and OH so much more besides. You know what it is. Films To Be Buried With goddammit. Get you some and ENJOY!


––––– ––––– –––––


THIS WEEK'S LINKS:


• JAYDE ADAMS on TWITTER!

• JAYDE ADAMS ON TOUR!

item.title: Jack Whitehall - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #13
item.itunes:title: Jack Whitehall - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #13
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he catches up with old pal and UK comic and acting champ JACK WHITEHALL!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and good lord this week it’s a good’un - yes, you are warmly welcomed to sit in on his chat with acting and comedy champ JACK WHITEHALL!


Jack Whitehall! Yes indeed. Brett’s been mates with Jack for a long while now, starting out in comedy circles around the same time and blazing the open mic circuit leaving a trail of smoke and ash behind them. This right here is the perfect chance to find out how Jack’s life has branched out ever since those younger, more innocent days and how he went from parka to poetry with consummate ease, his love of Disney and Robin Hood (and tights, by proxy), he and Brett sewing seeds of a future football film or series (that would be amazing and I hope they make good on that), his rise to full stardom through comedy and acting which led to his current high watermark of acting alongside The Rock, and some fine crying on plane talk. Crying on a plane while watching a film is known as “AALS” by the way, in case you’re pondering - or “altitude adjusted lachrymosity syndrome”. Whip that one out next time at yer pub quiz eh? So relax, throw on a pair of tights (it’s what Jack would have wanted yo to do), and enjoy these two getting their chat on about movies and all things besides.


DON'T FORGET!!! FILMS TO BE BURIED WITH - Live at the BFI - November 3rd!!! Links to come...


––––– ––––– –––––

item.title: Nathaniel Metcalfe - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #12
item.itunes:title: Nathaniel Metcalfe - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #12
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he gets into the world of cinema and mortality with good pal and awesome funny person NATHANIEL METCALFE!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he and his guest go deep into the subject of mortality via cinema, and this week you are treated to a guest appearance from Brett’s good friend and general funny person NATHANIEL METCALFE!


A thoroughly enjoyable and jolly episode and a great chance to get to know Nathaniel if you are yet unfamiliar… A full on selection of cinematic treats and experiences to get into from start to end, as they go in on open mic nights and what they really think of them (it’ll be no surprise), Nathaniel’s Twitter film viewing habit and what that’s all about, wanderlust versus potential ultimate enlightenment, developing mind tricks from early dealings with a paper wrangler, his napping dad, unintentional comedy, troubling sexy films at a young age, the slowness and length of 80’s films in retrospect and all the rest of that good good goodness that you have come to expect and deserve from Films To Be Buried With! Thanks for listening. Enjoy!


––––– ––––– –––––

item.title: Jen Brister - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #11
item.itunes:title: Jen Brister - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #11
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he gets into the world of cinema and mortality with the glorious and hilarious JEN BRISTER!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he digs deep into the world of cinema and the subject of mortality (and SO much more) with the awesome and hilarious comedian JEN BRISTER!


Recorded deep into their individual runs at the recent Edinburgh Fringe, enjoy the war-torn survivors as they share a full on fun-packed hour or so unpacking this whole life business and the films contained therein… You can expect all manner of science, ranging from their experiences working the mind-altering Edinburgh circuit, how she eventually took off proper in the comedy world, the importance of new material and keeping everything fresh as possible, her escapism and sanctuary through films as a teenager - world films especially - and how this followed through into her present day life, afterlife chat with some theories on quick deaths, terrifying films they - and possibly we - watched as kids and continue to disturb to this day (thanks for nothing, Threads and Watership Down), awakenings via the film Pretty Woman, and some straight up personal talk INCLUDING a few revelations you will hear for the FIRST TIME EVER on this podcast! Yeah that’s right. Jen’s dropping EXCLUSIVES up in here. So get yer popcorn set up, rustle a pack of Wine Gums why not, and join the two as they go IN on the whole lot. Enjoy!


––––– ––––– –––––


THIS WEEK'S LINKS:

item.title: Cariad Lloyd - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #10
item.itunes:title: Cariad Lloyd - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #10
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he runs through a selection of cinematic treats with writer, character performer and sketch comedian CARIAD LLOYD!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein to go through the tragedy and comedy of this whole life business, all against the backdrop of the history of cinema, all joined by writer / character performer / sketch comedian and more, CARIAD LLOYD!


The tragedy and comedy parts are balanced out perfectly and expertly, and Cariad is a trained pair of hands on these subjects as you will have witnessed on her own ‘Griefcast’ podcast, where guests are invited to openly discuss grief and the wide world within. So here in this episode, along with a HUGE amount of film chatter, you can expect to hear about her honesty and approach to self-care with her show, the evolution of her own grief through the show, good old fashioned small talk and the art of, being married to a film maker, theories on death, her obsessive Star Wars viewing as a child, resigning from any future horror film fanclubs through watching The Shining, more crying after having kids, crying on cue versus ugly crying, the bullshit of the stages of grief, freedom to laugh at women being gross on screen and how the history of the UK isn’t often taught in as great detail as it could. A hugely varied and entertaining episode, which you are sure to enjoy from start to end. Get into it!


––––– ––––– –––––


THIS WEEK'S LINKS:


• CARIAD LLOYD on TWITTER!

• CARIAD on THE INTERNET!

• CARIAD on INSTAGRAM!


• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on TWITTER!

item.title: Ed Gamble - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #9
item.itunes:title: Ed Gamble - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #9
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he runs through a selection of cinematic treats with UK comic and TV superstar ED GAMBLE!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he catches up with pal ED GAMBLE, fellow Edinburgh Fringe resident and UK comic and television champion!


A nice and giddy episode as Brett and Ed join up deep into their respective runs at the Edinburgh Fringe, high off insomnia and crepes, and down for some good time fun and entertainment. It’s a bundle of fun for certain but do be warned, there are some elements where some heavy films are referenced - so with that in mind, be prepared for some potentially tough ground in there… ALSO - there are spoilers for Hereditary so watch out for that when they start going in… I’ll make a note below on times. Otherwise, this episode has it all! Big men acting as nannies, Hulk Hogan, horror chat, film gossip, just tons of fun for you devour and get dizzy from, like these two. Highly enjoyable - go in!!!


––––– ––––– –––––

item.title: Ola The Comedian - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #8
item.itunes:title: Ola The Comedian - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #8
item.itunes:subtitle: LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he runs through a selection of cinematic treats with the one OLA THE COMEDIAN!
item.description:
LOOK OUT! It’s only Films To Be Buried With! Join your host Brett Goldstein as he runs through a selection of cinematic treats and experiences with the one OLA THE COMEDIAN!


As well as the usual fun and good time chat you have come to expect and deserve, Brett goes in nice and detailed with Ola as they go in on EVERYTHING… So much to unpack… So sit back and enjoy this one as they tear apart all manner of subjects including - from the very start - reading one’s accolades out loud and the difference of US and UK hosts in that regard, how film watching is a difficult task being a new dad (a tale as old as time), blagging his way through mafia film synopses, his preparation for adulthood by his mum showing him some heavy going film selections, enjoying the idea of people hanging out in sitcoms and not wanting real-life hangouts to end (think Kramer in Seinfeld), watching films in the US and romanticising the experience, keeping in touch with his Nigerian heritage again via his mum, and Nollywood! Told you it was a rammed one… Satisfying and nourishing - please enjoy!


––––– ––––– –––––


THIS WEEK'S LINKS:

item.title: Kerry Godliman - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #7
item.itunes:title: Kerry Godliman - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #7
item.itunes:subtitle: Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to 'Films To Be Buried With' with Brett Goldstein! Enjoy this week’s special guest, the fantastic acting and comedy superstar that is KERRY GODLIMAN!
item.description:
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to 'Films To Be Buried With' with Brett Goldstein! Enjoy this week’s special guest, the fantastic acting and comedy superstar that is KERRY GODLIMAN!


Much fun to be had as Brett catches up Kerry (Brett’s on-screen wife in Derek among other roles), and discovers a whole lot about her and her wicked and weird movie selections which range all across the boards. A ton of ground covered as always, as the two get down to some fun and interesting subject matter (and subject natter) including the nuance between bulletpoints, beating Ali Wong to the punch by doing standup while pregnant, words of wisdom about not exposing kids to harsh films early (right on!), using kids as an excuse and the techniques therein, film nights with her folks, how she tends to steer clear of revisiting already watched films, an interesting horror film theory, committing to crying at films in front of the kids, “angrysad”, her wonderful deconstruction of a failed Ken Loach audition, a Christmas cinema experience in Chiang Mai and male and female friendships. So much fun. ENJOY!


––––– ––––– –––––


THIS WEEK'S LINKS:

item.title: Steven Cree - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #6
item.itunes:title: Steven Cree - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #6
item.itunes:subtitle: Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to 'Films To Be Buried With' with Brett Goldstein! Please welcome aboard the dark lord of Scotland, the actorial legend who is STEVEN CREE!
item.description:
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to 'Films To Be Buried With' with Brett Goldstein! Please welcome aboard the dark lord of Scotland, the actorial legend who is STEVEN CREE!


A powerfully fun episode for you this week as Brett catches up with acting pal Steven, star of many a film and show including the excellent ‘Outlander’ and, as you shall hear, the classic ‘John Carter’. Oh, you will hear about that one… It’s a fantastic and jolly one, on which Brett goes all the way in on history including Steven’s shows he performed in when he was a kid, his brother Derek’s influence on his career (and how funny Derek’s name is), being a wardrobe assistant to Brett, the reality or coincidence of spiritual moments, being placated after a rough show, the crazies of Los Angeles, quicksand, an amazing story about his worst film and - yes indeed - the one line that won’t quit… His role in John Carter… So enjoy. The episode is long… “and so too will the chuckling be yours, Earthman*”…

(* this will make sense in the fullness of time, trust me)


––––– ––––– –––––

item.title: Beattie Edmondson - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #5
item.itunes:title: Beattie Edmondson - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #5
item.itunes:subtitle: Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to 'Films To Be Buried With' with Brett Goldstein! Please welcome up to the comfiest, cosiest seat in podcasting - it’s acting superstar and all round winner BEATTIE EDMONSON!
item.description:
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to 'Films To Be Buried With' with Brett Goldstein! An amazing show for you this week as Brett is joined by full on all round acting superstar BEATTIE EDMONDSON!


It does come up in the show, organically of course, but Beattie is the daughter of Jennifer Saunders and Ade Edmondson - this is only pointed out to provide some context for her upbringing, in so much as she was exposed to the in front and behind the scenes action of film and TV sets from a very early age so you know she’s schooled in the trade! You may know her from her various sketch groups she’s appeared in or from her multitude of roles on big and small screen, but now’s your chance to get to know her through her choice of films throughout her life. What a choice she has here too - an amazing get together with she and Brett, and one which will certainly make you a friend and fan upon listening! If you are not already, naturally. Enjoy!


––––– ––––– –––––

item.title: David Earl aka Brian Gittins (Edinburgh Fringe bonus) - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein
item.itunes:title: David Earl aka Brian Gittins (Edinburgh Fringe bonus) - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein
item.itunes:subtitle: Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to 'Films To Be Buried With' with Brett Goldstein! It’s an Edinburgh Fringe bonus as Brett is joined by David Earl aka Brian Gittins!
item.description:
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to 'Films To Be Buried With' with Brett Goldstein! BONUS EPISODE TIME is upon you as a treat for being an awesome and highly appreciated listener - here’s a special from up at the Edinburgh Fringe with Brett and good friend David Earl aka Brian Gittins!


The often referenced man himself, Brian Gittins, joins Brett in a rare one-on-one podcast in Brett’s comedy cottage, where the two sit very close to one another (Brett sitting like Michael Parkinson in full interview mode) and get deep into movie talk. From the outset, Brian might appear a little foggy but oh good heavens does that change as the episode goes on… It turns out he’s a proper film nerd, so enjoy Brett teasing all kinds of goodies out of the man, starting with good old fashioned death talk, then venturing into topics such as film locations, theories on why action stars were huge in the 80s (a very interesting theory indeed), bad films and cult bad films and how they obviously didn’t set out to be bad, film theft vs homage, and a ton of other fun.


BE SURE TO CHECK OUT BRIAN’S SHOW ‘DON’T FEED THE MONKEY MAN’!

ALSO BE SURE TO CHECK OUT BRETT'S SHOW 'WHAT IS LOVE BABY DON'T HURT ME'!


––––– ––––– –––––


THIS WEEK'S LINKS:

item.title: Scroobius Pip - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #4
item.itunes:title: Scroobius Pip - Films To Be Buried With with Brett Goldstein #4
item.itunes:subtitle: Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to 'Films To Be Buried With' with Brett Goldstein! What a perfect treat of a guest this week - yes indeed, it is the Distraction Pieces Network head honcho, label boss and actor Mr Scroobius Pip!
item.description:
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to 'Films To Be Buried With' with Brett Goldstein! Where some might say “three is the magic number”, or throw around tired phrases like “third time’s a charm”, THIS podcast does not deal with such nonsense and we go RIGHT on into episode 4 like it’s nothing. What a perfect treat of a guest this week too - yes indeed, it is the Distraction Pieces Network head honcho and label boss Mr Scroobius Pip!


Of course, on top of the music stuff, Pip is the goddamn man when it comes to podcasts - he heads the ‘Distraction Pieces Podcast’, which is well over the 12 million listens mark now and keeps on keeping on in much the same way. He is also very hooked up in the movie world, from being a fully fledged film nerd to running a film night at the Prince Charles Cinema to hatching into a proper actor! So you know you’re in good hands here with Brett and Pip - nothing but film geek goodness, which will go into how they got introduced to each other (their ‘meet-cute’ if you will), why Pip is referred to as Brett’s “frequent collaborator” on Wikipedia, end of year film lists, full on actor talk and process and all that good stuff, the weirdness of seeing the film you’re in for the first time, his own death scenario (in regard to Brett’s question which forms the basis of the podcast!) and his own outlook on life, death and the afterlife or lack thereof. It’s got it all, and you’ll be full to bursting at the end of this slammer of an episode. Strap in - this one GOES…


––––– ––––– –––––


THIS WEEK'S LINKS:


• SCROOBIUS PIP on TWITTER!

item.itunes:summary:
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to 'Films To Be Buried With' with Brett Goldstein! Where some might say “three is the magic number”, or throw around tired phrases like “third time’s a charm”, THIS podcast does not deal with such nonsense and we go RIGHT on into episode 4 like it’s nothing. What a perfect treat of a guest this week too - yes indeed, it is the Distraction Pieces Network head honcho and label boss Mr Scroobius Pip!


Of course, on top of the music stuff, Pip is the goddamn man when it comes to podcasts - he heads the ‘Distraction Pieces Podcast’, which is well over the 12 million listens mark now and keeps on keeping on in much the same way. He is also very hooked up in the movie world, from being a fully fledged film nerd to running a film night at the Prince Charles Cinema to hatching into a proper actor! So you know you’re in good hands here with Brett and Pip - nothing but film geek goodness, which will go into how they got introduced to each other (their ‘meet-cute’ if you will), why Pip is referred to as Brett’s “frequent collaborator” on Wikipedia, end of year film lists, full on actor talk and process and all that good stuff, the weirdness of seeing the film you’re in for the first time, his own death scenario (in regard to Brett’s question which forms the basis of the podcast!) and his own outlook on life, death and the afterlife or lack thereof. It’s got it all, and you’ll be full to bursting at the end of this slammer of an episode. Strap in - this one GOES…


––––– ––––– –––––


THIS WEEK'S LINKS:


• SCROOBIUS PIP on TWITTER!

• DISTRACTION PIECES PODCAST!

• SPEECH DEVELOPMENT RECORDS!


• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on TWITTER!

• BRETT GOLDSTEIN on INSTAGRAM!

• TICKETS TO SEE BRETT @ THE EDINBURGH FRINGE!

• 'SUPERBOB' - Brett's 2015 feature film!

• 'CORNERBOYS' with BRETT & SCROOBIUS PIP!
